boardgame.name: Distant Frontiers Deluxe Set
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Introducing the Orbital Deployment Ship "Phoenix Dawn," and four new alien landscapes!
This premium deluxe set of all four Distant Frontiers 22 x 34 inch double-sided posters includes four 5 x 8 inch terrain cards (one for each poster) and two exclusive double-sided wraparound covers that provide even more bonus terrain that you can use to customize the printed maps: Add a detention block to your capital ship, raise the tech level with a teleportation platform, or set the engines to critical with a red-hot reactor meltdown!

The ODS "Phoenix Dawn" is built from four separate posters: the Bridge, Residential, Engineering, and Cargo Quadrants, each of which is 100% compatible with the Orbital Docking Station maps from "Distant Outposts." Meanwhile, each map features part of an adjoining starship that forms the upper deck of a complete starship if you position the posters with the ship in the middle.

Meanwhile, the frozen Base Camp, exotic Alien Jungle, arid Desert Outpost, and desolate Asteroid Base maps on the back of these posters provide you with a variety of exciting adventure locations to explore!

Each deluxe set is packaged in a reusable clear plastic display box for safe shipping.

boardgame.name: Distant Outposts Deluxe Set
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Orbital Docking Station and Mining Colony
This premium deluxe set of all four Distant Outposts 22 x 34 inch double-sided posters includes four 5 x 8 inch terrain cards (one for each poster) and two exclusive double-sided wraparound covers that provide even more bonus terrain that you can use to customize the printed maps! Create a holographic imaging chamber in the heart of the space station, repair battle-damaged areas, or flood the cooling chamber beneath the foundry!

The Orbital Docking Station consists of the Commercial Quadrant, Science Quadrant, Hangar Quadrant, and Administration Quadrant, each of which can be combined in a variety of ways to change the layout of the station. Meanwhile, each map features part of an adjoining starship that forms one complete deck plan if you position the posters with the ship in the middle.

The Mining Colony consists of the Rooftop, Upper Level, Ground Level, and Sublevel, all of which match up vertically via stairwells, elevators, and ventilation ducts for a multi-level adventure location like no other.

Each deluxe set is packaged in a reusable clear plastic display box for safe shipping.

boardgame.name: Surveillance Station
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

There's something out there...

This set of 12 double-sided terrain cards (plus 2 bonus cards inside the covers) presents orbital and aquatic varieties of a complete remote outpost. The tiles can be combined in a huge variety of ways to build a new base of operations, drifting in space or floating on ocean waves. Included are tiles depicting hangars, medical suites, barracks, storage vaults, sensor dishes, control rooms, lounges, and landing platforms.

Each card measures 5 by 8 inches, and is printed on thick glossy cover stock. The printed set is gathered in a clear resealable envelope for safe and easy transportation.

The downloadable PDF version includes a third variation of the station set over a warm cloudscape.

boardgame.name: Deep Vistas Adventure Set
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

10th Level Characters
6 Poster-sized Maps
3 Acts
1 Chance for Freedom...

This special bundle collects the first three Deep Vistas double-sided posters, along with a harrowing 4th Edition adventure that uses all six of the maps!

Fall of the Heretic Queen is a 36-page adventure that places your heroes in the desperate clutches of the Scarab Queen, a heretical dark elf matron at war with her own city! The Deep Vistas map collection was designed and playtested specifically for use with this module.

User summary:

This collection gathers materials previously published as:


Fall of the Heretic Queen
Deep Vistas 1: Stalactite Gate and The Chapel of Scarabs
Deep Vistas 2: The Slave Pits and Dark Courtyard
Deep Vistas 3: Chasm Bridge and The Silent Garden

boardgame.name: Bruxelles 1897: Playmat

boardgame.name: Deep Vistas Deluxe Set
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Complete Deep Vistas Collection! A dark underground kingdom awaits...

This premium deluxe set combines all four Deep Vistas 22 x 34 inch double-sided posters (8 maps), along with each poster's 5 x 7 inch terrain card, and three EXCLUSIVE map panels, made just for this set: a vacant temple for the Fane of the Serpent Lord, and two levels of a perilous prison suspended above the magma-filled Chasm Bridge!

The Deep Vistas maps illustrate a kingdom of subterranean horrors and dungeons perfect for any medieval fantasy adventure, and several of the maps fit together to form the sprawling "Deep Vistas Delve," a continuous stretch of dungeon terrain over 7 feet long!

Each deluxe set is packaged in a reusable clear plastic display box for safe shipping.

boardgame.name: Cavern Tunnel Tiles - Pack 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The darkness hides many secrets...
...not all of them want to be found.

This set of 12 double-sided terrain cards (plus bonus terrain inside the covers) presents a sprawling cave system rich with subterranean features on one side, while vacant of specific details on the other. Meanwhile, a sheet of extra terrain elements is included for you to cut out to further customize the cavernscape. Mix and match the tiles to create your own tunnel system, or use the cover as a guide. Highlights of this set include the Bone Heap, Crystal Mines, and Sunlit Grotto, just to name a few!

Each card measures 5 by 8 inches, and is printed on thick glossy cover stock. The complete set is gathered in a clear resealable envelope for safe and easy transportation.

boardgame.name: Cavern Tunnel Tiles - Pack 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

That which dwells in darkness...
...does not like to be disturbed.

This set of 12 double-sided terrain cards (plus bonus terrain inside the covers) seamlessly continues the cave system from Cavern Tunnel Tiles, Pack 1. The environment is rich with detailed map features on one side, while empty on the other. A unique sheet of extra terrain elements is included for you to cut out and use to customize the landscape to fit your encounter design perfectly. Mix and match the tiles to create your own cavern from the ground up, or use the cover as a guide. Some highlights of this set include the Webbed Passage, Deep Pool, Rock Pile, and the dead end of a Collapsed Tunnel!

Each card measures 5 by 8 inches, and is printed on thick glossy cover stock. The complete set is gathered in a clear resealable envelope for safe and easy transportation.

boardgame.name: Forsaken Lands Deluxe Set
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Landscape of Adventure and Opportunity Awaits...
This premium deluxe set of all four Forsaken Lands 22 x 34 inch double-sided posters includes four 5 x 8 inch terrain cards (one for each poster) and two exclusive double-sided wraparound covers that provide even more bonus terrain that you can use to customize and extend the printed maps! Build a rustic cabin in the center of the Forest Glade, or add the two-part coastline extension to transition the surface maps seamlessly to the Sunken Ruins beneath the water's surface.

Each Forsaken Lands poster map depicts a distinct and detailed environment ready-made for adventure all on its own, but when you place the maps edge-to-edge they form a continuous (and treacherous) adventure map over 17 feet long! Start at one end of this Dungeon Odyssey and explore your way through the Glacial Rift, into the Mountain Tombs, and down into the Deep Caverns. Once you emerge through the Swamp Caves, continue on into the Forest Glade before finally plunging deep into the Sunken Ruins!

These maps are designed to be appropriate for sci-fi, fantasy, and modern encounter design alike, so that you can prepare yourself for the journey ahead--no matter where your imagination takes you.

Each deluxe set is packaged in a reusable clear plastic display box for safe shipping.

boardgame.name: Railway Station Tiles
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It's the end of the line...

This set of 12 revised and expanded double-sided terrain cards (plus 2 bonus cards on the back of the covers) presents a futuristic train system and the boarding facility of an isolated detention base. The tiles can be combined in a huge variety of ways to build different prison outposts or industrial facilities.

Based on the very first terrain card set produced by Maps of Mastery™, each train tile now features "interior" and "rooftop" views on opposing sides. Plus, all-new sections join the original set of tiles to provide an expanded train and even more terrain to explore.

Each card measures 5 by 8 inches, and is printed on thick glossy cover stock. The complete set is gathered in a clear resealable envelope for safe and easy transportation.

boardgame.name: Mass Transit Deluxe Set
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Offworld Spaceport: Your gateway to the galaxy!
This premium deluxe set of all four Mass Transit 22 x 34 inch double-sided posters includes four 5 x 7 inch terrain cards (one for each poster) and two exclusive double-sided wraparound covers that provide even more bonus terrain: A brand new VIP courier shuttle, and a complete two-deck starfighter hangar section for The Nova Eclipse!

An host of different vehicles on these Mass Transit let you set up rich sci-fi encounters in space or on the ground, while the spaceport sections fit together in a variety of ways to produce a sprawling travel and freight installation. It's the perfect launching point (or the ultimate destination) for your spacefaring campaign!

Each deluxe set is packaged in a reusable clear plastic display box for safe shipping.

boardgame.name: The Complete Mass Transit PDF Collection
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Build the ultimate spaceport!

This 122.8 MB ZIP-compressed archive of 40 PDF image files contains all of the maps that have ever been published as part of the Mass Transit poster series, along with a host of special extras including:


Special Editions of The Nova Eclipse and Offworld Docking Port maps featuring a passenger module in place of the ship's detachable cargo pod
Separate map tiles of the Transit-Class cargo shuttle from the Offworld Shipping Center
Alternate versions of maps, such as an empty Cargo Dock with all of the shipping containers cleared out
Extra terrain card images to change the original maps in new and different ways
Versions of each poster map image without colored terrain lines
Every terrain card image from every printing of every Mass Transit poster

boardgame.name: Battle Stations Deluxe Set
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Complete Battle Stations: Your gateway to the galaxy!
This premium deluxe set of all four Battle Stations 22 x 34 inch double-sided posters (8 maps) includes four 5 x 7 inch terrain cards (one for each poster) and two exclusive double-sided wraparound covers that provide even more bonus terrain: An elevated watch tower for the center of the Simulation Deck, an Armored Dropship to add to the Mobilization Deck, and the hull surface of the Troop Transport for when the action moves to the top of the parked vehicle!

The eight different decks on these posters can be stacked vertically or positioned side-by-side to create an epic sci-fi installation of your own design. Whether the players are trying to take over the galaxy or take down the tyrants who already have, these maps are the perfect accessory to any sci-fi campaign with a military theme.

Each deluxe set is packaged in a reusable clear plastic display box for safe shipping.

boardgame.name: The Complete Battle Stations PDF Collection
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

That's no moon!

This 226.2 MB ZIP-compressed archive of 48 image files contains all of the maps that have been published as part of the Battle Stations poster series, along with special extras including:


9 separate map tile images depicting the lower deck, upper deck, and hull surface of the Firetrain-Class Light Courier ship parked on the Hangar Deck
Versions of each poster map image without colored terrain lines
The terrain card images from the back of each Battle Stations cover card
Bonus map images and variants not included with the printed products


Best of all: If the Battle Stations poster map series is ever expanded (as long as this map store exists), this archive will be updated to include the new maps and you can get the them at no extra cost! Think of it as your passport to future adventures!

boardgame.name: Deck Space Deluxe Set
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Complete DS Series! With the Deck Space maps on your gaming table, the adventure possibilities are wide open...
This premium deluxe set of all four Deck Space 22 x 34 inch double-sided posters (8 maps) includes twelve 5 x 8 inch terrain cards for you to cut out and use to build your own encounters, along with double-sided wraparound covers that provide even more bonus terrain exclusive to this set: a security checkpoint for the Railway Floor map, an oasis for the Windswept Dunes, and a black hole for the Stellar Frontier!

The DS series maps (Deck Space, Distant Starscapes, Desert Sands, and Dangerous Seas) are designed to give you great big open terrain maps devoid of specific features, and sheets of objects and obstacles that you can use to build a different encounter every time you put them on the table.

Each deluxe set is packaged in a reusable clear plastic display box for safe shipping.

boardgame.name: Sci-Fi Cargo Tiles 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A new frontier awaits! Choose your gear wisely...

This new set of 14 terrain cards includes 150 different pieces of terrain designed to be cut out and placed on existing maps to add new features or alter the layout. They can also be used to build customized encounter locations for any sci-fi game. Each card measures 5 by 8 inches, and is printed on thick glossy cover stock. The complete set is gathered in a clear resealable envelope for safe and easy transportation.

boardgame.description:
Upgrade kit includes:

3-D Buildings: 3D plastic shrines, temples, and fortresses (previously cardboard tokens).

Armies: Miniature meeples (previously cubes). These have been included in previous Shogun Big Box Kickstarter campaigns, and have been tested to work in the cube tower. Please note we are not able to sell the upgrade kit without them.

Tokens and Revolt Markers: Plastic bits with heat-transferred image (previously wood or cardboard tokens). Please note these are the some tokens that have recently been seen in the very popular Board Game Geek "GeekUp" kits.

Metal Coins: Custom designed metal coins. The design for the coins is still a work in progress, but they will most likely be printed in Europe, and we are striving to have the best quality metal coins we can.

boardgame.description: Red Wings: Aces of the Sky is a dynamic action game that will show you amazing battles straight from the pages of history in a brand new arcade gameplay style. boardgame.name: Partisans 1941
boardgame.description:
User summary
Partisans 1941 is a real-time tactics game with stealth elements, set on the eastern front of WW II. As an army commander behind enemy lines you gather a group of Partisans to wage guerilla warfare against the German occupants.


A new approach to the stealth tactics genre: Partisans 1941 combines stealth, action, resource management and base-building elements.

Take control of a group of Soviet partisans resisting the German occupation during World War II. Plan and initiate combat your way. Use tactical pause, study the environment and choose the best position to set up an ambush.

Build up your resistance camp hidden deep in the woods and find allies to join your cause. Form squads of unique Partisans and undertake diverse missions to undermine enemy forces and infrastructure, while securing resources desperately needed to sustain the resistance.

As red army commander Alexey Zorin you escape a Nazi prison camp. Gather a Partisan squad from soldiers left behind enemy lines and locals. Live with your squad all the way from small sabotage missions to attacks on the occupational forces’ authority.

Play a leading role in an operation initiated by Red Army staff quarters and conducted by all Partisan teams in the area: A strike on the German forces’ supply lines for the frontlines, with the goal of buying additional time for the defenders of Leningrad to prepare against the German attack.

Tactics
Fresh approach to the stealth tactics genre. A new way to play real time tactics – mix of combat, stealth, ambushes and a variety of special items to bring chaos to the enemy ranks. Choose your own way of completing each mission.

Game play modes
Lead a squad of Partisans. Build a squad of your choice and level up your Partisans. Use your character’s strengths to find the right solution to different situations. Find and recruit new resistance members.

Your camp
Experience the life of a resistance group. In between missions you witness the routine of a Partisan’s life – develop your base, prepare for the next assignments, ensure you have the resources for the Partisan’s survival. Keep your troops motivated. Explore nearby regions, skirmish for enemy weak spots and opportunities to strike the enemy.

Background and story
A different perspective on WW II. Experience the story of fierce soviet resistance against ruthless German occupation on the Eastern Front. See the story and motivation of different people joining the Partisan resistance, military as well as common folk.

Source: The Game Website.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 Global Game Awards Best Stealth Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Permute
boardgame.description:
Permute is an abstract strategy game inspired by the Rubik’s Cube. In Permute, two players take it in turns to twist 2x2 sets of pieces on the board, attempting to 'solve' together connected groups of their pieces. The player who builds the bigger solved group wins the game – but at any time, the opponent can step in and twist your groups apart again!

How to play:

Permute is played on a square board filled with orange and yellow playing pieces in an alternating checkerboard pattern. Orange always plays first. Players take it in turns to select a 2x2 area of the board, called a ‘face’, and twist the pieces within that area 90 degrees clockwise or counterclockwise, as if rotating the face of a 2x2 Rubik’s Cube. After twisting, the active player must flip over or ‘bandage’ one of her pieces in that face; bandaged pieces may not be part of any more twisting moves for the remainder of the game.

Over the course of the game, the accumulating bandaged pieces eventually make any further twists impossible; at that point, the game is over. Players then count up their largest connected ('solved') group of pieces of their colour; pieces only count as connected when they are horizontally or vertically adjacent. The player with the largest solved group of pieces wins the game. If the players are tied for the largest group, then the second-largest groups of each player are compared to determine the winner; if those are also tied, then the third-largest groups are compared; and so on.

Permute is a scalable game and can be played on any board size.
Playing on a 12x12 board is recommended for casual play, and a 16x16 board for deeper strategic contests. A typical game on a 12x12 board will last 40-50 turns; a 16x16 game will last 70-80 turns.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Mkuskaland
boardgame.description:
The little squirrels were hungry in the big game. Help them find the squirrel mother and the delicious acorns among the foliage!

Who manages to feed all his squirrels first? A twisted, fun developer board game? not just for the preschooler age group.

In the game, squirrel children must be fed acorns in a small forest (5 trees, plus a meadow). The turbidity lies in the fact that the puppy squirrels only eat acorns if their mom is with them on the same tree (of course there should also be a free acorn among the foliage). The game can be "controlled" with a uniquely assigned dice (squirrel mother's move / acorns on one of the trees / little squirrel on the tree / or a jolly joker option, when we choose from the possible actions). Luck is needed to win, but that way at least the kids can beat their parents well.

boardgame.name: Voyage: The Last Refuge
boardgame.description:
Voyage: The Last Refuge is a pure solo sci-fi survival game.

Tragically your Home-world must to be abandoned, forced into space aboard a great vessel the remaining members of your species will slumber. You the ships AI, is tasked with safe keeping and delivery of your species as on the aeon long voyage across the stars all in the hope of finding a new home world."

During your turn you must draw & face cards representing various space born dilemmas requiring you to manage limited resources, deeply ship assets and specialist and make tough decisions that affect the thousands of passengers and ongoing mission.

Scanning and assessing the planet for the viability of settlement. It's not easy to find the ideal world, so it will take a number of voyages to start improving your odds (adding more viable locations as the game progresses)

Winning the game requires you to find and colonise the best possible planet for your passengers. How well your established colony is dependent on the voyage you have had and the condition of the ship and it's passengers.
Not all seed ships will find their way. So beware not to get to be scrupulous, space is dangerous and the ship can't hold together forever as with each passing Aeon the ship will deteriorate.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Fish Flip
boardgame.description:
It’s finally the weekend! You and your friend head down to the stream to enjoy nature, catch some fish, and have a friendly competition. Players will be catching the six different species of fish, tactically flipping them in order to catch the fish in-between the same type of fish. The player who catches the most fish plus does the best on the bonus for the game is the winner!

In this two-player game players will be flipping fish in a stream which the goal of manipulating the stream so that larger fish of the same type surround smaller fish of a different type in order to catch them. Doing their best not to set up their opponent for the next turn.

Fish Flip is a very tactical competitive puzzle game that plays in about 20 minutes.

—description from the designer

Children ask a thousand questions. We as adults are afraid to ask - because we are supposed to have understood it already. In the bestseller "Erklärs mir, als wäre ich 5" basic and extraordinary questions shall be answered easily. The card game will make your head smoke by giving you answers where you first have to find the right questions - answers that aren't necessarily correct, but sound plausible. For all lateral thinkers, inquisitive people and know-it-alls, that like to be fooled with from time to time...

-Loosely translated from the box

boardgame.name: Pictionary Air: Kids vs. Grown-ups
boardgame.description:
This new version of Pictionary Air is a head-to-head battle of kids vs. grown-ups!

This new design allows the younger kids to have an easier time drawing in the air. The clue cards for kids now have pictures on them as well as words, to give them a visual reference for their drawing. In addition, every clue on each card for kids is worth two points, whereas only the last clue on each card for grown-ups is worth two points (all others are worth one point).

There are also new, updated clue cards for grown-ups as well.

boardgame.name: Rules Pack 1: Battle Events New Rules for Five Leagues from the Borderlands
boardgame.description:
This expansion pack adds in-battle random events to your games of Five Leagues From the Borderlands.

Applicable to pretty much any campaign, the pack includes 20 random events that can happen during battles, as well as options to tailor the frequency.

Examples include a mysterious scholar wandering the battle field and the battle turning into a three way fight, as well as simpler fare like finding a shiny coin or a deathly fog descending on the battle field.

This is a supplement for Five Leagues From the Borderland 2nd edition and requires the core rules to play.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Big Lockdown
boardgame.description:
The Big Lockdown is a tongue-in-cheek card game inspired by people’s experiences whilst in Lockdown during the global pandemic. The game is filled with references to life in lockdown including toilet paper hoarding, home schooling, and work meetings conducted from the toilet.

The aim is to build your stockpile of supplies whilst avoiding infection.

Deciding which of two decks to draw from lets you decide the risks you're going to take. Winning the game is the about balancing these dangers: do you stay at home, safely consuming supplies, or will you venture into the daunting outdoors to build your stockpile?

Players can collect cards that gain them supplies, allow them to loot other from other players and give them a chance to force other players into risky positions.

A fun and funny game for the whole family to enjoy.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: We Have a Problem, Mr. President
boardgame.description:
The only job tougher than being President is being the ADVISOR to the President. Recommend the right moves, the Prez gets the glory. Mess up, and you’ll be put to bed with a shovel. Only the best, brightest, and--yes--those who catch a few breaks survive to enjoy the perks of the work. “We Have a Problem, Mr. President” puts you on the hot seat in the Situation Room as a National Emergency unfolds. It’ll be your job to juggle resources, prioritize problem-solving, and wring out maximum wallop from every ounce of your available political capital as the days tick by and the crisis escalates. Get the country through this, and you WILL be rewarded--maybe even snag a lucrative book deal. Come up short, though, and you’re bureaucratic rubbish--eagerly jettisoned and quickly forgotten.

In this game, you are put in charge of implementing policy decisions for the president during a national emergency. Your goal is to successfully navigate the crisis by dismissing various problems in an escalating pressure cooker environment. During your turn, you will reveal a potential crisis situation and then use dice and your political capital to try and handle the situation. After you come up with a gameplan you still have to get the presidents' approval or it's a no go. If the problem is not solved it carries over and you will lose status. Lose too much and you'll be looking for another place of employment.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: We Have a Problem, Mr. President: Historical Expansion

Publisher's blurb:

Desperate people dwell in desolate places...

This set of 12 double-sided terrain cards (plus bonus terrain on the back of the the covers) presents a sprawling natural cave system of ice and snow on one side. But flip the cards over and you can populate those glacial caverns with a hidden sci-fi base! Mix and match the tiles to create your own tunnel system or outpost, or use the cover as a guide.

Combine Glacier Base Tiles, Packs 1 and 2 to build an even larger snow cave/installation!

Each card measures 5 by 8 inches, and is printed on thick glossy cover stock. The complete set is gathered in a clear resealable envelope for safe and easy transportation.

boardgame.name: Glacier Base Tiles - Pack 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Shelter can be found in unexpected places...

This set of 12 double-sided terrain cards (plus bonus terrain on the back of the the covers) presents a sprawling natural cave system of ice and snow on one side. But flip the cards over and you can populate those glacial caverns with a hidden sci-fi base! Mix and match the tiles to create your own tunnel system or outpost, or use the cover as a guide.

Combine Glacier Base Tiles, Packs 1 and 2 to build an even larger snow cave/installation!

Each card measures 5 by 8 inches, and is printed on thick glossy cover stock. The complete set is gathered in a clear resealable envelope for safe and easy transportation.

boardgame.name: Modular Starship Tiles 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Build the ship you need for the mission at hand...

This set of 12 double-sided terrain cards (plus two extras on the back of the covers) provides everything you need to build your own scientific research vessel, survey scout, or starfighter carrier gunship! Mix and match the tiles to create countless variations, and rearrange them as needed to change the configuration of your own specialized spacefaring vehicle!

With two sets you can double the size of your deck plan, or display two completely different vehicles at the same time...

Each card measures 5 by 8 inches, and is printed on thick glossy cover stock. The complete printed set is gathered in a clear resealable envelope for safe and easy transportation.

boardgame.name: Colorium
boardgame.description:
("Colorium"), a new galaxy far away, has emerged. Every second, new stars light up in it, the laws of physics appear and vanish, chaos recedes, and the forces of the universe come into balance. You are the young guardians who must be ready to structure the chaos and channel cosmic flows under constantly changing circumstances.
Each round during a game of , the players will be drafting a pair of a shape and a color from the dice pool and gradually filling their own boards with the corresponding pieces of polyomino.
The gameplay is intuitive as it abides by the basic principles of Tetris, but the scoring system turns into a tactical and strategical gem: will you go for another color to get a guaranteed bonus at the end, or is it worth to expand one of the colors you have already to score points for a mission? Will you climb up to the top to gain a bonus, even if that could mean ending the game much sooner than the other players?
The game goes on until no one can draw another shape in their grid, and whoever scores the most points wins!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Academic Floor and Tutorial Halls
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

School is in session! Do you have what it takes to pass with honors?

The Academic Floor includes study rooms and specialized classrooms for astronomy, geography, and theater, while the Tutorial Halls provides places to study alchemy, crafting, and other topics...and even a dueling hall for the practice of mystical or martial arts!

This double-sided poster measures 22 by 34 inches, and is printed on glossy poster stock. It's pre-folded to 8.5 by 5.5 inches and packaged within a clear resealable envelope for safe and easy transport.

Includes a 5 by 8 inch terrain card that depicts the top of the Astronomy Tower.

boardgame.name: Dormitory Floor and Library Halls
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to your home away from home! A place to rest, research, and recover in style...

The Dormitory Floor provides a warm and inviting residential wing for your castle, complete with a hospital ward! Meanwhile, the Library Halls downstairs give you a vast collection of tomes and scrolls to enrich your mind. Just beware of what you find in the restricted section!

This double-sided poster measures 22 by 34 inches, and is printed on glossy poster stock. It's pre-folded to 8.5 by 5.5 inches and packaged within a clear resealable envelope for safe and easy transport.

Includes a 5 by 8 inch terrain card featuring a Revivification Laboratory you can add to the upstairs tower.

boardgame.name: Upstairs Corridors and Entrance Halls
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The gates are unlocked and the torches are lit! It seems someone was expecting your visit...

The heart of your castle awaits, with the Upstairs Corridors presenting guest accommodations, a ballroom, and a royal suite overlooking the grand staircase! Below, the castle's Entrance Halls welcome visitors with lavish appointments and beautiful galleries.

This double-sided poster measures 22 by 34 inches, and is printed on glossy poster stock. It's pre-folded to 8.5 by 5.5 inches and packaged within a clear resealable envelope for safe and easy transport.

Includes two 5 by 8 inch terrain cards featuring a Spiked Pit Trap and a pair of additional tower sections that can be used to expand the map during play.

boardgame.name: The Great Hall and Castle Dungeons
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The tables are set! The royal feast beckons--but so do the mysteries below...

The Great Hall provides your castle with kitchens and a vast gathering space set for a glorious feast! Meanwhile, the Castle Dungeons shows the deep subterranean foundations of the stronghold, complete with magical laboratories and a secret temple!

This double-sided poster measures 22 by 34 inches, and is printed on glossy poster stock. It's pre-folded to 8.5 by 5.5 inches and packaged within a clear resealable envelope for safe and easy transport.

Includes a 5 by 8 inch terrain card featuring a magically lit Invocation Chamber that can be placed on the Castle Dungeons to alter the map during play.

boardgame.name: Halls of Legend Deluxe Set
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Complete Halls of Legend Collection! Your own multi-level castle in a box...
This premium deluxe set combines all four Halls of Legend 22 x 34 inch double-sided posters (8 maps), along with each poster's 5 x 7 inch terrain card, and three EXCLUSIVE map panels, made just for this set: a chandelier to suspend over the main staircase, a secret dormitory hidden behind the castle walls, and the personal chambers of a headmaster or magus who lives within the highest tower!

The Halls of Legend maps illustrate a sprawling castle complex of halls, dungeons, and towers perfect for any medieval fantasy adventure--or any modern or historical tabletop games that take place within such an ancestral stronghold.

Each deluxe set is packaged in a reusable clear plastic display box for safe shipping.

boardgame.name: Extraplanar Realms
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Your astral journey awaits!

These three 22 by 34-inch poster-sized PDF images depict regions of a foreign dimension with a faint 1-inch grid for use with miniatures.

The Astral Sea is a vacant expanse of cloudy silver space that can serve as a distant plane, a surface of reflective water, or a cloudy skyscape depending on the needs of your games.

Astral Nexus depicts objects of gray stone drifting in that space, some of them chained together as a sort of abstract and mysterious ritual space.

Finally the Astral Debris bonus variant shows the same rocks untethered and without adornment.

Included with the poster-sized images is a 4 by 8-inch Luminous Cave section that adds a blue radiance to one of the holes in the Astral Nexus rocks.

These PDF-exclusive images have never been commercially printed.

boardgame.name: The Maps of Mastery PDF Omnibus, Volume 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Complete First Volume: Every product through 2016!

This is the entire digital archive of every map published by Christopher West's Maps of Mastery through the end of 2016, in one downloadable set of PDF image files! Includes hundreds of terrain cards and dozens of poster map images--many of them available nowhere else--and all at print-quality resolution.

Every side of every poster map in these series:


Mass Transit
Forsaken Lands
Deep Vistas
Deck Space
Distant Starscapes
Desert Sands
Dangerous Seas
Battle Stations
Distant Outposts
all with and without terrain lines!


Every terrain card set...


Railway Station Tiles
Sci-Fi Cargo Tiles 1 & 2
Surveillance Station
Alien Starship Tiles
Cavern Tunnel Tiles 1 & 2
Night Life
Dimensional Timeship Tiles
Glacier Base Tiles 1 & 2


Every variation and alternate version, including versions of the sci-fi posters with color-coded terrain lines.

AND bonus unpublished maps...

Battle Arena
Lunar Surface
Gray Wasteland


2.03 GB worth of image files in total!

boardgame.name: Finding Anastasia
boardgame.description:
THE STORY
In the year 1918 the Russian people revolted against the Monarchy. It was believed that the royal family was eliminated. However, a rumor claims that the Czar’s favorite daughter, Anastasia, survived and has been in hiding from those that are pursuing her. Her Grandmother, the Empress Dowager, heard the rumors and decided to make it her mission to find Anastasia. After years of searching, the Empress invited those who claim to be or know Anastasia to a party, where the Empress hopes to learn enough to find Anastasia.

GAME OVERVIEW
One player is the Empress, while the rest of the players are guests. To find Anastasia, the Empress and her guests must ask questions of each other. The responses are marked on a central board for all players to see. By listening to the answers and exchanging hidden clue cards with each other players must deduce who is and isn’t Anastasia. As questions are answered, gems are given to players. The gems can be used on a player’s turn to perform actions such as gaining clues, revealing roles, or asking additional questions.

The game continues until Anastasia is found or a role ability causes the game to end. Will the Empress find Anastasia? Will Rasputin's Agent find Anastasia first? What other guests will show up to this party? Play Finding Anastasia to find out.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Credo
boardgame.description:
Credo was a board used for playing a variety of different abstract games, primarily two-player games adapted for three players although two-handed versions could be played on it as well.

The board came with a booklet which in addition to Chess gave rules for many Draughts/Checkers variants, Nine Men's Morris, Reversi/Othello, Chinese Checkers, Halma, and other games.

boardgame.name: Nikoli's Pencil Puzzle
boardgame.description: Nikoli's Pencil Puzzle is a set of four different logic puzzle categories: Hashi, a bridge-connection puzzle; Shikaku, an area-filling puzzle; Akari, a hidden-space puzzle similar to Minesweeper; and Sudoku, a numbers puzzle. Each of the four categories has between 70 and 300 puzzles separated into Intro, Easy, Normal, and Hard, for a total of 600 puzzles. Attribution: User Summary

boardgame.name: Water Bears VR
boardgame.description: Water Bears VR is a puzzle game in which the player uses plumbing equipment such as pipes, valves, and mixers to route various water sources to their proper destinations. The destinations are signified by sleeping tardigrades in different colors: each creature wants to be showered with a certain color of water. When the correct color stream contacts all the water bears' bodies, they express delight and rise to float around the player's head, ending the level. Successively more difficult levels are presented to the player.

boardgame.name: Neurony w akcji
NeuroRace
boardgame.description:
("Neurorace") is a bright and exciting brain-teasing game where the players will be trying to complete different missions of a constantly increasing complexity as fast as possible.
Each round, each player will have a mission card with a row of requirements and a whole common pool of double-sided tiles to complete it with. Whoever is the first to complete their mission goes up a level that will require even more careful planning and multitasking! As soon as the 10th level is completed, the winner is determined.
There are three game modes: BASIC — for equally skilled players, ALL-ARE-EQUAL — for the players of different gaming skills and ages, and SOLO — for one player. In the basic mode, everyone starts from level 1 and whoever completes level 10 first, wins the game. In the All-Are-Equal mode, there is no playing along: elder players start with the higher levels and whenever level 10 is completed, it’s the number of completed missions that counts. 
The game is fully adjustable, so you’ll be able to find the perfect balance for your group and make sure everyone is having fun on this race of neurological connections!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2021 Geek Media Awards Game of the Year for Beginners Nominee

boardgame.name: Wizard Tournament
boardgame.description:
("Wizard Tournament") is a fast-paced spell-shouting game of reaction in which players take on the roles of young wizards swinging their wands, casting spells, summoning magic crystals, and protecting themselves from the Dark Lord.
Each player starts the game with a magic wand, 5 crystals of one color of their choosing, and 1 crystal of each color that was not chosen for the game.
The game is played over a series of rounds. Each round, 2 dice are rolled. Die sides correspond to the colors of the magic crystals. Additionally, one die contains a white side and another die contains a black side.
Different combinations make different players cast certain spells (Attackus, Defendus, Captus, or Iamsafus), and whoever is the first to do it right either protects their crystals or gets a chance to take one from the opponent — or even steal some from the Dark Lord himself!
Whenever one of the players has the majority in three crystal colors and doesn’t have the Dark Lord’s mark on them, the game is over and that player is declared the winner!
Count fast, be sure enough to cast your spells with a steady hand, and don’t let other wizards get ahead of you!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Grand Bordeaux
boardgame.description:
A large part is devoted to Bordeaux itself, but other properties are located around the city.

Brown
Saint Michel (Bordeaux)
Cours Victor Hugo (Bordeaux)

Light Blue
Rue Sainte-Catherine (Bordeaux)
Les Chartrons (Bordeaux)
Cours du Chapeau-Rouge (Bordeaux)

Purple
Place des Quinconces (Bordeaux)
Place de la Bourse (Bordeaux)
Place des Grands Hommes (Bordeaux)

Orange
Eco-quartier Ginko (Bordeaux)
La Rivière
Portets

Red
Cadillac
Route du Médoc (Bordeaux)
Podensac

Yellow
Place de la Victoire
Place Gambetta

Green
Rue du Parlement Sainte-Catherine (Bordeaux)
Place du Parlement (Bordeaux)
Rue du Parlement Sainte-Catherine (Bordeaux)

Blue
Rue Montesquieu (Bordeaux)
Place de la Comédie (Bordeaux)

Stations
Les vélos Vcub
Gare Saint-Jean
Réseau TBC
Aéroport de Bordeaux

boardgame.name: Grimdark Future: Firefight Starter Set Assault on Outpost Lixus
boardgame.description:
Grimdark Future: Firefight is a miniature wargame set in a war-torn sci-fi future, which is played using 28mm miniatures.
The game mechanics are designed to be easy to learn but hard to master, bringing engaging sci-fi battles for new and experienced players alike.

This starter set gives you everything you need to start playing exciting battles right away, without having to worry about painting miniatures or putting together your own army lists.
With game rules that fit on a single page, you'll be able to learn them quickly and start playing in no time!

The Assault on Outpost Lixus Starter Set contains all of the following:

Core Game Rules
Unit Stat Cards (10 Cards)
Battle Sisters Army (8 Miniatures)
Heroes: High Sister
Troops: Battle Sisters, Fanatic Sisters
Upgrades: Heavy Flamethrower, Fusion Rifle

Alien Hives Army (8 Miniatures)
Heroes: Snatcher Veteran
Troops: Assault Grunts, Shooter Grunts, Soul-Snatcher, Hive Warrior

Terrain Pack (11 Terrain Pieces)
Small: Fields, Crates & Barrels, Barricades
Large: Forests, Ruins

Play Tokens (106 Tokens)
Objectives, Activations, Wounds, Pinning
Magic, Suppression, Fatigue, Danger



—description from the publisher

("Dice Fishing") is a fast-paced and exciting dice-rolling game that feels a lot like real fishing!
Each round, the players take turns rolling 6 custom Bait dice.
There is a common row of Fish cards that is replenished after each player’s turn. Each card requires a certain set of bait to be placed on it. If all slots of the card are filled, the fish starts biting! The players can guess which of the 7 fish types they are about to catch — zander, trout, perch, pike, sturgeon, salmon, or ide — but they won’t know for sure until they flip the card and see it!
The larger the fish, the harder it is to catch it. Moreover, every fish might get away! In order to increase your chances, you will be mastering your fishing skills by resolving different Opportunity cards that will allow manipulating your rolls and the assortment of fish.
During the game, the players score additional Achievement tokens for different sets of their fish and as soon as anyone collects 7 different fish, they score the endgame Achievement token. After the final scoring, whoever has the most VP wins!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Bogus Survival
boardgame.description:
Bogus Survival invites players to use story-telling to escape weird and wacky scenarios. You can find yourself stuck on a marooned island, chased by a line of shopping carts, or even blackmailed by Winnie the Pooh. In each case, players will need to get creative to get out.

A game starts by splitting teams into equal survival skill. By using tool cards to create a cohesive escape narrative, the guessing team's survivalist gives clues to his team about which scenario card they are escaping. The opposing team, having selected the card, eagerly hopes they guess wrong.

Guess the scenario card correctly and the survivalist and their team are awarded the survival card. But guess wrong, and the point goes to the opposing team.

There's no time for bickering or second chances: the first team to 3 survival cards wins.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: SuperTmatik Quiz Benfica
boardgame.description:
SuperTmatik Quiz Benfica, a test of knowledge on Benfica's athletes, titles, historical facts, curiosities and much more.
Each card contains questions of different levels and a letter (S U P E R T).
Each player tries to answer questions faster than his opponent(s).
The first player to complete the "SUPERT" before his opponent(s) wins.

Each deck includes 54 cards; 378 questions and their answers; 4 degrees of difficulty. Instructions in Portuguese

SuperTmatik Quiz Benfica, um verdadeiro teste aos seus conhecimentos sobre o Glorioso (atletas, títulos, factos históricos, curiosidades e muito mais). Cada baralho inclui 54 cartas; 378 perguntas e respectivas respostas; 4 graus de dificuldade. Instruções em Português

boardgame.name: Sebasto
boardgame.description:
Similar to 3’s, but with special dice labeled 0-4 and a special symbol for the 6th value.

Players roll all 6 dice saving at least one die and rerolling the remaining dice until they are satisfied or all 6 rolls are finished. If the special symbol gets rolled and saved, the value of the dice get multiplied by two for every special symbol rolled. Players who accumulate 101 points are eliminated. Rolling a six of a kind wins the game. Whoever has the lowest score after 10 rounds is the winner of the game.

Game Includes: 6 Sebasto Dice, Score Pad, Pencil and Game Rules.

boardgame.name: Mr. Lobo's Monster Match Game
boardgame.description:
YOU ARE INVITED! In the spooky Chestburster Mansion, Horror Host Mr. Lobo throws a party for Misunderstood Monsters to Mix and Mingle! Of course, Frankenstein, Dracula, Werewolf and Mummy get lucky, find their matches, and leave ealry. The B-Grade ghouls like Robot Monster, Phantom of Krankor and Gappa the Trifibian Giant even end up paring off! Soon, all the "Kool Kreatures" are gone... WILL YOU BE STUCK WITH MR. LOBO??

—description from the designer

All cards are shuffled and the deck is dealt out face down to each player. Players match all the cards that look alike in their hand and discard face up. Player to the left of Dealer draws one random card from the dealer's hand. If it matches one of the cards in their hand, they discard the pair on the table. Then they offer their cards to the player on their left, who draws a random card, and so on. Play continues until all pairs have been matched up and discarded. The player left with the "Mr. Lobo" card in their hand is the loser of the game and is laughed at! Then, awkward silence. Reshuffle and repeat!

—user summary

boardgame.name: Trek from the Vault
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Trek from the Vault is the thrilling sequel to DCC #30: Vault of the Dragon Kings. The scenario is intended to be played as a continuation of Vault of the Dragon Kings, using the same four pre-generated characters the party used in the levels above. Otherwise, this adventure is best suited for a party of 4-6 characters around 10th level. All classes will find this a suitable challenge, worthy of those who braved the perils of the Vault in the first place. The characters can begin Trek from the Vault immediately after the resolution of the final encounter against the mad silver dragon Myrkjartan in the Pool of Dreams from Vault of the Dragon Kings, or this can be played as a standalone adventure.

boardgame.name: Dylemat wagonika: Postacie i modyfikatory
Trial by Trolley: R-Rated Track Expansion
boardgame.description:
In Trial by Trolley, one player acts as the Trolley Operator and must choose where to send a murderous, out of control, trolley. Every other player at the table plays cards and argues in order to convince the operator to spare their lives and condemn everyone on the other track to a gruesome death-by-trolley.

This dirty expansion for Trial by Trolley adds 100 extremely R-Rated tracks for you to hit with a trolley. There’s a lot of really bad stuff in here. You’ve been warned!

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet

listing.notes:
Brand new copy of the game, in shrink wrap.
Shipping to EU would be 10 euros and the package should arrive in 7-10 days. Elsewhere please ask!
Check out my other products for sale as well! If you buy multiple items, I will combine shipping costs. Its much cheaper this way.
weight: 187 grams + packaging
Title: Trial by Trolley: R-Rated Track Expansion Publisher: Skybound Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Trial by Trolley: R-Rated Modifier Expansion
boardgame.description:
In Trial by Trolley, one player acts as the Trolley Operator and must choose where to send a murderous, out of control, trolley. Every other player at the table plays cards and argues in order to convince the operator to spare their lives and condemn everyone on the other track to a gruesome death-by-trolley.

This dirty expansion for Trial by Trolley adds 100 awful R-Rated modifiers to spice up your trolley murders. There’s a lot of really bad stuff in here. You’ve been warned!
