Title: Trial by Trolley: R-Rated Modifier Expansion Publisher: Skybound Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Champion of the Krystal
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

For many an Age has the Krystal been the treasure and the heart of a nigh mythical Order of Priestess stewards, guardians of the Kingdom of Roland and its people both seen and unseen. Yet now they are gone. Their protection is fleeting, and just as when the sun is obscured by the cloak of night, so is all the realm being invaded by other-worldly forces of evil, by restless spirits and legions of dead men. Many believe the Krystal has been broken, that its phantoms have escaped, and that the only way for the mists to return behind the curtain of night and the dead to return to their graves is for the Krystal to be made whole again. The Kingdom waits for a group of heroes to journey the length and breadth of the lands and find the lost shards of elemental faith, and with them, to heal the Krystal. Will those heroes be you? Can you find all the lost shards before all is lost?

Part 1 of the first ever Fantasia Adventure Trilogy! Designed so that it can be played after Parts 2 and 3 if you desire a different story.

boardgame.name: Destroyer of the Krystal
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

For many an Age has the Krystal kept imprisoned an evil spirit who is bound to a mysterious vessel of darkness known only as the Cauldron. Now the Cauldron has awoken, and it is devouring the very light from all life in the Kingdom. Hopes, dreams, the very essence of living souls fade as the depths of the Cauldron hunger. Nothing can withstand the awesome power of this darkness. Many believe the Krystal will soon crack, and thus its prisoners will be released into the world. How can it be stopped? There is only one way, and that is to seek the very heart of darkness, the Cauldron itself, with such awesome light of courage that will make it cower, quail at what other powers it might release, or yet choke on its endless feast. But only heroes posses souls which shine so bright. Will those heroes be you? Can you find the Cauldron before it devours you?

Part 2 of the first ever Fantasia Adventure Trilogy! Designed so that it can be played before Part 1 or after Part 3 if you desire a different story.

boardgame.name: Legacy of the Krystal
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

For many an Age has the Krystal been broken and made anew, a circle that entraps evils and destroys them. But this wheel of fate must be turned by the efforts of heroes, who themselves hold in their own hearts the greatest potential to fall. Now, the time has come when the circle renews. The Krystal has been remade into Rings, in which form it came to this world, and in which form it will be delivered. Many believe the Krystal a treasure, but in truth it is a spirit, a light, a power, and its home is in the mythical island-city of Ayrravathia, resting place of great heroes. Now, the greatest heroes of this Age must resist the evil bound within these Rings and bear them across the sea to this Holy land, where they can be purified and the circle begun anew. Will those heroes be you? Can you reach Ayrravathia before the dark power in the Rings destroys you?

Part 3 of the first ever Fantasia Adventure Trilogy! Designed so that it can be played before Parts 1 and 2 if you desire a different story.

boardgame.name: Heaven's Gladiator
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Mortals endlessly fight wars, but for what? No greater reason than personal gain or glory? The one who is the true warrior waits for a war which shall serve a greater good, leaving greed to the gladiator. But what if the Heavens should seek nothing more than good spectacle? How are their gladiators to be chosen, and what foes will they face? And what is the prize for the victors? By divine will, a grand journey awaits you, one to travel the length and breadth of Valdale, searching for the elusive Tower of the Valkyrie. Can you fell all foes on the road and in ruins and dark forests? Can you find your way through moors, mountains, and the burial grounds of Kings in the sky? All the Angels are watching, and the Valkyries waiting...

boardgame.name: Iron Mountain Caverns
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The smoky den of the Lonely Inn is the first, or perhaps the last place the adventurous soul sees. It stands on the edge of maps, the threshold of the world of adventure, shadowed both by the great mountains and their greatest legend. The entrance of the legendary Caverns is gigantic, and yet, it is dwarfed by their interior. One descends seemingly forever by winding ways, along cliffs and chasms the Common Tongue is too weak to describe, or for the sane mind to fear, for only the discovery of great adventure and treasure is possible in those bewildering depths. Many brave adventurers have vanished into legend, indeed into the darkness of the mountains and their caverns. Can you be the first to venture there and return with its fabled riches? Will you have valor enough to conquer the Iron Mountain Caverns?

boardgame.name: The Sword of Lost Souls
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Lost in the unknown regions of the night and nightmares, beyond the crumbling walls of Mortals’ understanding, there awaits a prize like no other, a Sword of untold power . . . It has slept in the secret desires and dreams of Men since the world was shaped. Few know of its existence, if it exists at all. Indeed, you alone can search for this incredible treasure. And if you can find this relic, what will you do with it? Tonight, Fate plays a deadly game, and wise would be he who foresees that with winning such a sword of great power comes the fate of using it against a great evil...

boardgame.name: Malkor's Maze
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You have heard the tales of Malkor and of the fabulous treasure he hid away in the mazes. You have also heard of the other Wizards of his Order, whose spells helped build the maze that guards their treasure. The Wizards have gone and the world has forgotten them, but their treasure remains. Dare you explore the mazes and seek the gold of legend? What awaits you is a collection of classic dungeoneering adventures, a challenge even to seasoned adventurers, with deadly traps, riddles, puzzles, and monsters lurking around every corner.

boardgame.name: Castle Kragg
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Atop a lonely hill of ancient stone stands the ruins of Castle Kragg, a place of twilight tales and local superstition. As deeply rooted as its stone walls are in the land itself is the castle rooted in local legend. Monsters are said to lair in the ruins, and ghostly sentinels walk the ramparts. Now, you have come to this desolate place. Could you be the first to enter this castle and return? What secrets and treasures await you? Even now you can hear the ghostly garrison walking the darksome halls, their mail clinking and their voices whispering of an Age long passed.

boardgame.name: The Enchanted Valley
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Are you in search of wisdom? Are there secrets of your life being kept from you? Do you posses treasures whose magic remains unknown to you? Now, all your questions may be answered in the enchanted valley! For therein awaits the Sage of the Seasons, who has lived many a lifetime and indeed is said to know all there is to know. But gaining an audience with him won't be easy, for you must first prove your wisdom by finding him, a test that will lead you all through the valley along a maze-like network of paths, riddled with challenges of every kind.

boardgame.name: Territh Nor
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Guarding the entrance to forbidden lands, the tower of Territh Nor looms up black and impassable in the cloudy sky. A foul stronghold of Orcs and their evil spawn, the tower is a threat to the peaceful lands from which you have come. An entire army of Orcs could be within those mighty walls . . . hopefully more. Can you stand against such odds? Your sword is thirsty and there will be blood! Lots of blood! Can you defeat the Orcs in their stronghold, claim their treasures, and break the dark spells that fortify the tower?

boardgame.name: The Black Forest
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

At the end of the road, a new road begins . . . leading to dark adventure. For beyond the lake lies the Black Forest. The innkeeper and his patrons fear the forest and they warn you to stay away. The forest is a place of legends, twilight tales and haunting superstitions. What evil could make the local people so fearful? And, could you vanquish that evil, so that the people could live in peace? Many terrors and treasures alike await you under the dark boughs of those ancient trees, as endless surprises and challenges oppose your efforts to find the dark heart of these strange woods.

boardgame.name: Highgate Cemetery
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Great warriors become Kings by their own hand and bring mighty Wizards to their knees, but even the strongest heart grows cold when he enters the realm of the restless dead. Rare is the soul who can walk amongst the headstones or take the paths of the dead and not feel the chill of the Outer Darkness. Dare you enter the aged walls of Highgate Cemetery? Legends from all over the world speak of this ancient and accursed place, where evil boils up from the Underworld, poisoning the earth and causing the dead to rise up from their graves. Can you find the black heart of this evil world and send it back to Hell?

boardgame.name: Oracle's Tower
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Deep in the forest lies a secret. Travelers take the longer roads to avoid it. Wise men only speak of it in whispers. But Fate is leading you there. With every story you hear, with every day that passes, you come closer and closer to the ruins of the old Wizard's tower. Oracle's tower. His enchanted stronghold has remained silent for centuries, keeping its secrets hidden well within the vaults of time. But now the time has come to either put a lie to the legends or reap the rewards of daring to enter a Wizard's keep. What wonders await you within?

boardgame.name: Grendelstine
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The heights of Bloodstone Mountain have ever been shrouded in mist, born, most say, of the restless fires within her belly. While lesser men speak of Dragons and tell tall tales of Giants working their smithees beneath the earth, those brave souls that have dared trespass there know Bloodstone by another name, Grendelstine, the castle that once guarded its mines now a prison of agony. For there does the dark lord of the land keep all who defy him trapped within the Hell of that ruined castle. And now, he is sending you there! But ever does evil undo itself, for within the fiery bowels of the mountain there are others trapped as well, who can help you even as you lead them to freedom.

boardgame.name: The Haunted Keep
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Far out on the lonely Diminyrr Moors, there stands a ruin without windows and without doors, a black edifice amidst an endless land of fog and fear. Nobody knows when it was built or by whom. Far from civilization, only the brave and foolhardy seek its hidden gates, hidden indeed because rather than keeping anyone out, this dark ruin is said to keep spirits trapped within, like a tollbooth between the world of the living and an abyss of untold evil. But what power is so strong that it can hold back such horrors? If the legends are to be believed, that power and the prize for anyone who can conquer the evil held therein is nothing less than eternal life.

boardgame.name: Devil's Mountain
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

For all time has it stood, for all time has it cast a shadow of fear over the lands of Men; the Devil’s Mountain. Many are the tales told by those daring enough to have trespassed on its haunted summits. Yet one tale remains unfinished, filling the hearts of all Men with darkness. Indeed, what is the dark heart of the mountain itself? In the old village of Rivernorth, in the shadow of this ancient mountain, the locals tantalize you with the stories of their ancestors, whose legacy is an entire castle upon the black peak. They say there is a treasure there with the power to change the future by the will of he who possesses it. What lies in your future upon Devil’s Mountain?

boardgame.name: Tac-Tile Choss
boardgame.description:
Tac-Tile Choss is Japanese dialect which is used at Hokkaido, Aomori and other north areas of Japan. It means touch, feel or finger.

"Choss" is a matching game with shapes and colors playable using only your sense of touch, sight is not required. Everyone, whether they are sighted or sight impaired, can enjoy playing together with equal footing.

Close your eyes, play the game and have fun conversation with everyone through the game.

The touch based components
There are 25 Tac-Tile tile pieces in the game. There are only 4 colors, pink, white, black, blue. But to help distinguish between the colors each color has a different touch pattern on the tile piece. e.g. the pink tile has 2 gems which protrude like braille, and the blue tiles have 3. Each Tac-Tile is enclosed in a wooden cap, and is played on a wooden board with indents to fit each cap.

How to Play:
All the pieces are placed face-down in the middle of the table.
On a player's turn they draw a piece and try to match it with any they have in their hand.
If they get a match they can reveal it or wait until they get a better match.

How to win
Points are award to matching the same shaped tiles, or bonus points are award if the shape and colors match.
If they match 3 different shapes of the same color they can earn the most points.

boardgame.name: The Swamp of Doom
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Woe to those who come to this land where no King rules. Try though you might to escape the marshes, the quagmire of your conscience will not allow escape for the dream of defeating this place and purging its evil. Yet this is a dream which can turn into a nightmare, just as a man can become a monster out on those moors. What is the unbreakable ring and evil king which is the doom of so many men? Can you learn its secret, and if so, can you defeat it? The howl of a distant, devilish wolf welcomes you to the boundless swamps from which no one ever returns. The mists are thickening, and the moon is rising. The black heart of this evil land is calling. What are you waiting for?

boardgame.name: Lionsgate
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Guardian of the only pass in and out of the land, the mountain fastness of Lionsgate stood for centuries, until the day a Dragon came and took the lives of everyone there, staining its once mighty walls with a curse which has endured ever since. It came for the treasures amassed by the crusaders. And now its hoard only grows, as its fiery spirit keeps all lesser souls trapped in the old walls, growing with all who come to slay it. Will you be the next to try? And if you dare, will your own treasures succeed where all others have failed, thus adding to the Dragon’s hoard? The old castle of Lionsgate awaits one with a lion’s heart, but remains a gate leading only to one’s doom.

boardgame.name: The Endless Gauntlet
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The entrance to the catacombs lies under a ruined Church, like a headstone for the countless warriors buried beneath it, the last remnant of a city of lost revenants. The dead lie asleep, silently listening and waiting. It is the quiet call of a Mortal heart to fight, to find adventure, even to die rather than continue the endless search through the darkness which at last awakens them. The catacombs are said to have no end, for those who enter them never return, thus are new crypts ever being called for. Can you be the first to find the heart of this maze and return to the world of the living? The dead are awaiting you...

boardgame.name: Temple of Eternity
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Who can seek eternal life? Who can master the art of time? What secrets does a temple to all such power hold for those who dare enter it? Mortals may seek this legendary place, but they do not find it. It finds them. Whether they stumble on the path to its front gate by a chance walk in the woods, or they are lost and starving and but think it another monastery, all who come here are invited by the spirits within. The gates are said to lead to a labyrinth, built by those from beyond this world, and guarded by all who have failed to pass its challenges. The temple has stood since the beginning of time, and will continue to wait for you to dare enter...

boardgame.name: The Lost Oasis
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The desert remains unchanged since the sunset of the Ancient Kingdom, a trackless realm where no King rules and where the Heavens are ignored by men and monster alike, leaving all journeys to the will of the Desert Fates. Yet one journey continues to call to the strongest and most magical of men, the road to the lost oasis of the Fates themselves. This ruined city is considered a myth by all save Nomad caravans and those unfortunate enough to find it, for the promise of eternal life is indeed but an oasis amidst a desert of peril. Now you have been chosen to find this legend and be the first ones to return. Chosen by the Nomads, by a need for survival, and perhaps by the Desert Fates themselves, can you find the Lost Oasis at the heart of all desert myths and be the first to return to tell the tale?

boardgame.name: Castle Perilous
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

There are endless stories and romances about the Wounded King, he who lies at the beginning of perhaps the most noble quest of all. His castle is in the center of a wasteland, a place where myth makes reality, and yet where all come in search of an ultimate truth. Looking up at the ramparts of staggered stone, and hearing not the sound of sentinels but the stories of your childhood echoing in your ears, your wonder lays siege to this ruin with an army of questions. Did the Grail itself ever rest here? Is the Wounded King still inside? Does the Dolorous Sword truly exist? The gates of this legendary castle stand open wide, as they have since the dawn of time, awaiting all who come seeking the greatest treasure and peril...

boardgame.name: Gilderwood
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

All villages have tales of who or what dwells in the woods beyond their borders, tales dark and bedeviled by other-worldly beings. At the Iron Dagger Inn, talk is tied to the Baron’s son, coming of age, and being taken away by the Fairy Folk for their own purposes. No one dares to guess what has become of him. Instead, their tales are bound as if by some spell or greed of Fairies as to what reward of treasure would await any who are brave enough to enter the gilded wood and find the lost Noble, and to bring him back. Time has never seemed to matter before. The dark woods have remained unchanged since the dawn of Men. Yet now, every passing hour seems a lifetime to the Royal Court, almost as if they can hear their lost son wailing within the enchanted forest...

boardgame.name: The River Styx
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Death. The Grim Reaper. The Angel of Death. There are many names given to this specter which stands on the threshold of the living world and the land unknown. Yet most agree it is not even real, a phantom, and nothing more. The river of death, the Styx, is the road to where this legend begins, the gates of the world of the dead. Yet is it, like the Grim Reaper, even real? Is it a myth? Or does this legend flow from the same source of fear? Indeed, is there a real River Styx to be found in the living world that can be explored to its end to learn the very secrets of death and immortality? There is, and you have found it...

boardgame.name: The Silver Tower
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

On the edge of the realm, on the borders where wars are fought and heroes and villains die, there stands this ancient tower, a stronghold feared by Warlords and Kings alike. Though the castle rests upon a secure mountaintop, easily commanding the lands around it, no army will dare go there to claim it. They do not wish to be claimed by the tower. Annually is treasure taken there as tributary to its other-worldly powers. Yet if you could defy those spirits, if you would dare to be the first in centuries to enter the tower, what untold riches would await you?

boardgame.name: The Mountain of Fire
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

High and foreboding it looms over the land, a fortress that defies time, a mountain of fire. Could an army of Angels have descended on that sundered height in times of yore to cast down defiant demi-gods? Could the mountain itself have consumed the palace atop it? Do the fires deep in its heart give unnatural life and power to a Dragon who conquered all of its own kind? And what of the treasures that the Dragon hoards? The mountain, known in myth as the Throne of the Destroyer, awaits any who would dare to challenge it and discover its secrets.

boardgame.name: The Amber Cathedral
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

High upon bleak, lifeless cliffs, overlooking the relentless slavework of the ocean tides, there rise the ruins of an Age-old Cathedral, where once Holy Men both purified the damned and set free the accursed. That was long, long ago, and some ancient evil has taken root in the hallowed halls and sanctuaries of stone. Roads bent away from this accursed place as the trees bend away from the four winds. Ships on the waves below steered themselves into the rocks further put to sea lest they be washed up on the headland under the shadow of the ruins and suffer a fate far worse. Peasant rumors patched the holes in the crumbling walls with grim faces and idols of evil untold, and still to this day they peer through the fog at any who approach the gates . . .

boardgame.name: Village of Shadows
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Lost in the mists, you come to a village cursed by a grim and sinful past. Its people are like ghosts, already given to despair and their doom. The village is like a maze, a dungeon of wood and whispers, with very real skeletons in the closets of its peasantry. Can you learn the truth of their dark past before it learns about you? Can you find the treasures of its former heroes to unlock the door to the curse’s heart? Can you solve the mystery of the village of shadows? Welcome, weary traveler. Rest peacefully in the tavern . . .

boardgame.name: Palace of the Lost Prince
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The people speak of a time when their valley was a paradise, where Men and Elves and Dwarves lived in harmony, united by their Prince within his fabled palace. No Crown did the Prince wear. He did not need one. The palace itself was the most potent symbol of all that was strong and spirited in the valley. Finally, a day came when all this legendary wealth became the prize of a warlord and his army. While they burned villages and murdered the peasantry, a curse fell over the palace itself, which even the fell army of evil dared not enter. In the end, all lay on the field, dead, and the palace remained silent and filled with fear. Even to this day, dark windows on its face look out into the valley, watching for any living prey who would dare to approach it.

boardgame.name: The Manor House
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

On the edge of town, the edge of civilization and of sanity, steeped in fear and folklore, it is said to be the domain of a thousand spirits, but there’s always room for one more. Any volunteers? If you insist on lagging in town, you may not need to volunteer. The curse of this castle has endured through many generations, many great families who lived in and ruled from the great old house, but it is the house which has outlasted them all. I know you’re curious to see what’s inside, so as it is said look alive, this one adventure you may not survive. Welcome, foolish mortals, to the Manor House . . .

boardgame.name: The Forgotten Forest
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Harper’s Woods have stood upon the edge of civilization for countless generations. Nobody dares go there, despite the folklore filling the hollows with hoards of treasure and lost magics from lost worlds. But will mere peasant rumors and old wives’ tales stop you? For who knows what great riches and secrets await the brave and the bold who venture into that timeless forest?

boardgame.name: The Road of Myst
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Roads are the lifeblood of the world, but this one, an old merchant route through many towns, has for years uncounted been plagued with evil. The towns have disappeared and the castles which once served to guard it have been abandoned. Nobody goes this way anymore. Tales say it leads on through fen and forest, swamp and death. If you could be the first to survive this road, surely along the way you will amass great fame and fortune . . .

boardgame.name: Orinach Tor
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Its walls are never dinned by night. For the ramparts of this legendary keep have been strengthened by stone and spell for over a thousand years. And, in this day and Age, an army of the dead is marching on the fabled keep. Though they can not break its walls, the Templar Knights who hold the keep are powerless to rout the invaders. It has now become a stalemate. What the defenders need most is a hero. Or a group of them. But will you risk an army of the dead? Most tales tell of one treasure of such power it could dispel the entire army, what is known as the very heart of the Tor and perhaps the heart of the Devil himself.

boardgame.name: Vallenheim
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Vikings in this frozen frontier tell of the son of the Sun, the Heart of the Traitor, and the Sapphire of Countless Facets. Like such a jewel indeed, these are all different ways to see the same treasure, kept by the Giants beyond the sea in their ice castle of Vallenheim. The Lord of Ravensfjord entrusts you alone to brave the seas and the world of ice. Shall you dare to enter the ice castle where Giants rule and steal from their vaults the very treasure of the Sun itself?

boardgame.name: The Lost City
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Lost at sea! Daring the sea-gods’ realm in the mightiest ship Men can make, it is nonetheless cast down by the storms and claimed by the depths. All you can do is swim for shore, where a strange tale begins. For the island is the height of an Ancient, lost city, a paradise sunk beneath the waves before time began. Is there some means here to return to the world you know? Or is there perhaps a greater treasure to be found?

boardgame.name: Zarclabeth
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Under the shadow of cloudy mountains, where Men fear to travel and the only laws are of sword and spell, legends speak of a maze beneath the earth, a city and a great underground empire. Men shun this ruin and keep clear of its crumbling walls. Rumors speak of beast-men hungering for living flesh and the unquiet dead who patrol the deepest chambers. Yet no matter the source, all stories have at their heart a fabulous treasure in the great vaults of these ancient dungeons. This is a classic maze designed to pay tribute to the earliest RPG modules and video games of the early '80s.

boardgame.name: Fantasia: Book of Quests
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

There are tales of greater deeds than any yet heard in Fantasia, tales to be told by those Player Characters who journey to the edge of the world and beyond . . . beyond indeed where even the rules of the game can serve them. For those journeys that become a quest, that take one to realms hidden from the Known World or beyond it, these rules serve as one's guide. Those elements of the story that make the hero of legend are all included in these ancient pages, from jousts with the Green Knight to encounters with the Rainbow Dragon.

boardgame.name: Lord of the Dragonstone
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Lost for centuries, sought by Kings, feared by Dragons, prized by Wizards, and the heart of battle that has spilled the blood of many armies, the Dragonstone at last is found . . . or is it? Can your party be the first to find this treasure, and if you can, what will you do with it? Will you be King? Slayer of Dragons? Lord of Wizards? Of armies? A great battle is coming, a battle in which only the use of the Dragonstone can give surety of victory. But where will your loyalty lie, and what will you become before all is over?

User summary:

Requires the use of Fantasia: Book of Quests (advanced rules sourcebook)

boardgame.name: Dawn of the Desert Fates
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Far out in the desert, the endless dunes of the Great Waste are steeped in legend, myth, and blood, keeping buried both secrets and dreams which sleep for all time . . . or do they? The fears of Men are crowned with the stone fortress of Hell’s Cauldron, so distant it is never seen save in dreams, yet now its armies are on the march, and the lands of Men may awaken into a reality worse than any nightmare. Before all is lost, will you be able to cross the desert, eluding the armies of darkness and reach the fiery heart of their fell Kingdom? And, what will you do once you enter Hell’s Cauldron?

User summary:

Requires the use of Fantasia: Book of Quests (advanced rules sourcebook)

boardgame.name: The Last King of Roland
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Kingdom of Roland is bracing for war! Fires leap up atop hills and peaks to signal the defenders of the realm, armies remote and without union. It is said that in Ages past, Dragonkind met their plight in the land of Roland, the same War which claimed the last King. And now, his surviving heir, his daughter the Queen Daphine has disappeared, and with her has gone the last hope of the realm. The Wise have now summoned you to rescue the Queen and restore her to the throne. For as it is foretold, the Dragon-spirit that has set fire to the furnaces of war shall only forge a new King and its own defeat. Could that King be you?

User summary:

Requires the use of Fantasia: Book of Quests (advanced rules sourcebook)

boardgame.name: The Eye of the Arcmage
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In the center of the Known World rises one of the greatest strongholds ever known, a castle no army have ever conquered, no wise man has ever explained, and no living being has ever dwelled in. It is a keep of legends, a dungeon of wild rumors. Since the dawn of the Second Age, tales abound about the Arcmage, giving him a hundred different faces over a thousand years of wars and quest. Those who seek his doors enter in search of great wisdom or power to aid all their earthly trials. None ever return. And now, magic throughout the Known World is fading like the morning mist, and only the Arcmage can see how to restore it. Yet in the end, will these Champions choose to let magic be lost or be renewed? Or . . . become their own world?

User summary:

Requires the use of Fantasia: Book of Quests (advanced rules sourcebook)

boardgame.name: Wilderlands
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The world is a vast place, and the road of adventure can lead anywhere. And, one may live their life for endless years or even find rebirth upon that road. And now you can walk that road too, for this booklet explores the wide world of Fantasia like no other! Contained within these pages are role-playing notes, lore, survival tactics and open-ended Encounters for use in all the world's roads, plains, forests, swamps, mountains and deserts. Use the 100 Encounters at your discretion to add to any ongoing adventure, or to form the basis for a simple, short adventure. The wilderness awaits!

boardgame.name: Dungeoneering
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

There is another world than the one we know, and any cave and any door can lead there. It is a world where great monsters and greater treasures await! Now, you can enter this world too, for this booklet opens the doors to all the secret chambers and nameless deeps under the earth! Contained within these pages are role-playing notes, lore, tactics and open-ended Encounters for all the different types of caverns, castles, halls, haunted grounds and mazes of the world. Use the 100 Encounters at your discretion to add to any ongoing adventure, or to form the basis for a simple, short adventure. The dungeons await!

boardgame.name: Adventurers
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

An adventure party is more than just a group of adventures, it is a fellowship, where Warriors and Wizards walk side-by-side, where Thieves and Burglars share secrets, and mysterious Elves and iron-armed Dwarves share a lasting friendship. Perhaps your fellowship is lacking strength. Perhaps you need a few more companions to assault the Dragon's lair. Now, your call to arms is answered, for this booklet provides a grand gallery of adventurers! Contained within these pages are Introductions for all kinds of Player Characters, plus 30 Non Player Characters ready to join your band. Lead on, your fellowship awaits!

boardgame.name: Storytelling
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Tales are the meat and drink of the soul, for without the stories of adventure and indeed those who undertake them, there is no colour left in life. Those adventurers are you and your friends, and those tales are yours to tell. However, what sort of tale one tells is not as important as how they tell it, and that is where this book shall help you. For contained within these pages are sample names, character quirks and many other details anyone may use to add flavor to the otherwise dull, dry nature of the black-and-white rules. Use the notes, charts and samples at your discretion to add to any adventure, or indeed, to any adventurer. The stories await!

boardgame.name: Legends
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Tales are told of deeds great and small, and of heroes and cowards, and of great beasts, greater monsters, and truths that turn out to be false. Those which are true are for you to discover, these tales yours to explore. However, what sort of truth one shall find depends on Fate, indeed of a Master’s design and of the impudence of chance. For contained within these pages are legends from throughout all the Known World, stories that may be true or false, which the game may build upon, either as the genesis for an adventure’s plot, or a tale told to divert the party away from greater truth, or perhaps simply to add depth to an existing scenario. Use these legends at your discretion to serve as the beginning, the spirit, or the culmination of any adventure. The legends await!

boardgame.name: Villains
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Tales are nothing without evil, victories are to remain hollow without peril, and heroes shall never be without villains which swing the first stroke. Truly, no adventure suffers from the suffering of its heroes, indeed for the addition of a villain, and that is how this book shall help you. For lurking within these pages are foes that can stand against any party of adventurers, each with their own story to tell, whose triumph can only come with the defeat of those who would stand against them. All manner of evil characters await to be unleashed into the game and add an element of true danger to the otherwise dull treasure hunts and exploration stories of the adventurers. In the depths of these dark pages shall true adventures begin! The villains await!

boardgame.name: Novelettes
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The world is teeming with adventure, in the wilds and within ruins alike. Sometimes, adventure lies just outside one's front door, or down the haunted lane from the tavern. Indeed, any road in any land can lead to this book, for within these pages are twenty 'mini-adventures' that can be played anywhere, anytime. They can be used for simple and short game sessions, or as chapters in larger stories, or the beginnings of far greater narratives.

boardgame.name: Satan's Labyrinth
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Created by no less than God to weigh the value of humanity with Lucifer himself awaiting you at the end! Easily referenced Maps that fit behind any GM's Screen will guide you to all 1000 fully developed rooms herein, each one with its own tale to tell and unique challenge, utilizing all creatures of the Fantasia setting, hundreds of battles, hundreds of original puzzles, hundreds of cunning traps, and a hundred Handouts worth of clues, altogether making up perhaps the greatest dungeon ever designed, from the ground... down. Created for Fantasia's game system, the countless enemies, traps, puzzles and perils will lead ever deeper through the underearth and through the very Nine Hells! In the greatest mazes below the world, your odyssey will forever continue against the awesome forces that oppose your efforts to reach the Devil's lair! Can you find him and defeat him? Can you truly slay all evil in the world? Can you overcome perhaps the greatest adventure ever designed for role-playing games? Requires the Fantasia: Book of Quests—Advanced Rules sourcebook.

EWARE!! You can't go into the Nine Hells without there being such horrors, graphic descriptions and material so offensive as to make one question their own sanity. This product is for mature players only. Parents, reluctant heroes, and everybody else, you have been warned...

boardgame.name: Fantasia: Book of Journeys
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to the realms of Fantasia, brave adventurer! You are wise, more than most, for while other adventurers wander the realms aimlessly, going from town to town in search of gold, you have in your pack a tome of invaluable lore, a guidebook to all lands, roads and realms of this fantastic world. Within these pages you will find everything from detailed statistics for the great cities of the lands to the smallest hamlets, from the legends of yore to the customs and cultures of the various peoples who inhabit this mysterious world. Truly explore the realms at last with this complete and comprehensive sourcebook.

boardgame.name: Penalty Challenge
boardgame.description:
Penalty Challenge is a football theme board game where players have to kick penalties (or stopping them) using cards, a die and chips.

There are three possible directions where the ball can be shot at: left, middle or right. Inside the goal each direction has circles with numbers. A penalty must be shot to one of the free circle. To do so, the shooter has to roll the die and get one of the numbers of the intended circle to score. If a shooter has a star, the number in the star of every circle will count as well.

A player in their turn will have the chance to kick a penalty at another players´ goal. The turn player will put a shooter card face down with the arrow pointing at the intended goal. Then the player of that goal will put a goalkeeper card face up showing their move to stop the penalty. Then, the shooter will reveal their card showing the ball direction. If the goalkeeper guesses it correctly (left, middle or right) they can put gloves chips (1, 2 or 3 gloves as their capacity) to block the circles. The shooter will indicate one of the remaining circles of that direction before rolling the die. If the goalkeeper does not guess it right, the shooter has all that direction circle options to choose. If the shooter scores it will count one goal in their scoreboard.

First one scoring 5 goals will be the winner of the game.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: La Bsqueda del Planeta X: Expansin Deluxe: Nuevo Horizonte
The Search for Planet X: New Horizon Upgrade Pack
Die Suche nach Planet X: Luxus-Pack
boardgame.description:
Includes:

8 Metal Tokens (2 per player)
48 Poker-Style Clay Theory Tokens (12 per player)
4 Player Trayz by GameTrayz

boardgame.name: Trivial Pursuit: dition Rhne-Alpes
boardgame.description:
Discover or rediscover the region of Rhône-Alpes in 1800 questions by playing with the new Trivial Pursuit rules which will allow you to win a marker triangle on all the squares of the board.

Content: 1 board, 300 question-answer cards, 2 card boxes, 1 die, 6 pie charts, 36 colored marker triangles.

boardgame.name: Trivial Pursuit: dition Nord-Pas-de-Calais
boardgame.description:
Discover or rediscover the region Nord Pas-de-Calais in 1800 questions by playing with the new Trivial Pursuit rules which will allow you to win a marker triangle on all the squares of the board.

Content: 1 board, 300 question-answer cards, 2 card boxes, 1 die, 6 pie charts, 36 colored marker triangles.

boardgame.name: Trivial Pursuit: dition Ile-de-France
boardgame.description:
Trivial Pursuit: Édition Ile-de-France
Discover or rediscover the region Ile-de-France in 1800 questions by playing with the new Trivial Pursuit rules which will allow you to win a marker triangle on all the squares of the board.

boardgame.name: Trivial Pursuit: dition Bretagne
boardgame.description: Discover or rediscover the region of Brittany in 1800 questions by playing with the new Trivial Pursuit rules which will allow you to win a marker triangle on all the squares of the board.

boardgame.name: Trivial Pursuit: dition Gastronomie
boardgame.description:
Awaken your taste buds with this new edition of the special Gastronomy Trivial Pursuit!
1800 questions and answers around the kitchen spread over all categories: Geography, Entertainment, History, Art & Literature, Science and Nature….
And surprises

Content: 1 board, 300 question-answer cards, 2 card boxes, 1 die, 6 pie charts, 36 colored marker triangles.

boardgame.name: Deck of Monster Summoning
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Deck of Monster Summoning is a deck of cards with various monsters on it, on each card a creature inside with elvish writing. Speaking the words will summon the monster and they will attack anything. Once card is drawn the only way to get a different card is to speak the word, they cannot leave any part of the deck laying around they will find that the deck will always be complete.

boardgame.name: Chase & Obstacles Deck
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

When a chase begins a DM or player draws a single card and places it face up and two more face down above it. This represents the first obstacle and the options for overcoming the obstacle. When an option is overcome as a group one of the two cards is flipped over to represent the next obstacle for that path of options. Each turn a creature(s) (individually or as a group) may use their action to attempt one of the presented options.

boardgame.name: Trivial Pursuit: dition des Vins
boardgame.description:
Impress your friends by answering questions on the geography of wines, the history of wine or the terroirs and grape varieties.

Content: 1 board, 300 question-answer cards, 2 card boxes, 1 die, 6 pie charts, 36 colored marker triangles.

boardgame.name: Deck of Many Horrors
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Tarokka is an interpretive card-reading activity that is part of the Ravenloft setting, used by the Vistani, and analogous to real-world tarot cards. A tarokka deck consists of 54 cards, each of which contains an illustration. The cards can be laid out in a specific arrangement in order to read fortunes. The names and illustrations of each card have a symbolic link to a certain theme. For example, the Hangman card represents endings.

boardgame.name: Inanimis' Deck of Many Things - Revised
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

All 22 of the Original Deck of Many Things cards rebalanced to avoid Campaign-Ruining moments.

boardgame.name: Loki's Deck of Amusements
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Everyone knows about the Deck of Many Things, but few know of Loki's Deck of Amusements. This item puts the wonder and danger back that the latest Deck of Many Things lost. An ancient and intelligent artifact that will play with you just as much as you play with it.

boardgame.name: Boomstud's Bauble Boutique
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A collection of custom magic items compatible with Dungeons and Dragons 5th Edition Ruleset.

boardgame.name: Deck of Not So Many Things
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Every single item in this deck has been created totally at random and they are useful for your Dungeons and Dragons campaigns.

boardgame.name: Living Spells: 33 Stat Blocks for Mournland Adventures
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Mourning rocked Khorvaire in 994 YK. Cyre was destroyed in a single day, leaving behind a wall of gray mist and a blasted, fundamentally-changed land. Soldiers and civilians alike were killed if they were lucky, altered horrifically if they weren’t, and magic that wove throughout Cyre’s everyday life took on a life of its own. A destructive, devouring life.

boardgame.name: Grazaxe's Deck of Marvelous Loot
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A deck of d20 fantasy play cards and magic items.

boardgame.name: Shop Rules
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Hello and welcome to my shop rules! The shop rules are meant to be used as the basis for a campaign, not just as a downtime activity. These rules are best for a group of adventurers who enjoy searching for treasure, hunting monsters, and building up a ridiculous amount of wealth through their adventures. Instead of constantly working towards a BBEG or other overlying end goal and going on adventures that specifically contribute to that goal, this campaign gives the DM a way to have many different, mostly unrelated adventures for the players but still gives them a constant sense of progression to work towards. Along with that, the rules give the DM opportunities to spark curiosity in their players about the shop itself and its origins.

boardgame.name: Century: A New World G1/H1 Location Board
boardgame.description:
This mini expansion is compatible with Century: A New World base scenario only.

Game Setup: During Step 1 of the Game Setup, create the game board by using either face of Location board G1/H1 instead of D1, E1, or F1. Follow the rest of the setup normally.

Actions:
New Trade Locations - first, perform the trade shown in the center of the location as many times as you like (at least once). Then take another turn immediately.

New refresh Fort location - Remove all four face-up point cards displayed above each Fort location and place them face down at the bottom of the Point cards draw deck. Then draw 4 new Point cards from the draw deck and place one of them above each of the Fort locations. Then take another turn immediately.

Available from the Dice Tower 2020 Kickstarter Campaign as part of the Builders Pack.

listing.notes: $5 shipping within Australia $10 overseas
New

Part of the Dice Tower 2020 Kickstarter campaign (Adventurers Pack).

boardgame.name: Pumpkin Patch: Bad Seeds Nicodemus Alternate Art Promo Card
boardgame.description: A promo card included in some pledges of the Promo Paradise Kickstarter, depicts an alternate art crow named Nicodemus. Replaces one of the crows that comes with the game.

boardgame.name: PARTYtura
boardgame.description:
PARTYtura is a game for 3-10 players in which the conductor is to lead an orchestra of the remaining players. In order to meet the expectations of the audience, everyone must maintain the right tempo and understand well the gestures of the conductor. Interestingly, the game will take place in silence - the music is realized in it by playing appropriate cards. Depending on the variant and the number of players, it is a cooperative or team game.

—description from the publisher (translated)

PARTYtura to gra dla 3-10 graczy, w której rol dyrygenta jest, aby pokierowa orkiestr zoon z pozostaych graczy.
Aby sprosta oczekiwaniom suchaczy, wszyscy musz utrzyma waciwe tempo i dobrze rozumie gesty prowadzcego.
Co ciekawe, gra odbywa si bdzie w ciszy – muzyka jest w niej realizowana poprzez zagrywanie odpowiednich kart.
W zalenoci od wariantu i liczby graczy, jest to gra kooperacyjna lub druynowa.

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Lupin Sansei: Pandora no Isan
boardgame.description:
Source: The Game Website.

Lupin Sansei: Pandora no Isan ( ? lit. Lupin the Third: Inheritance of Pandora) is an action game developed by Namco in 1987 for the Famicom. It is based upon the characters in the popular Lupin the Third manga and anime series. Players can select to play as Lupin himself, Jigan the marksman, or the renegade samurai Goemon.

The game's story appears to take place shortly after the 1979 movie The Castle of Cagliostro, as it involves the kidnapping of Clarisse, a character who was introduced in that movie. Players must infiltrate the locations of several suspects who may be behind the kidnapping, as they travel around the globe through four stages. Play style is a cross between side scrolling exploration, and the multi-tiered shooting concept originally explored in Namco's Rolling Thunder.

boardgame.name: Tezamen
boardgame.description: Tezamen is a special two-player strategy game in which luck also plays a role. However, as with life in general, you also need to be able to live with luck. The successful player constantly adapts to the situations that arise and thus tries to make the best decisions. In the throne room, the bodyguards protecting the king and the rebels face each other. The former want to evacuate the ruler, while the latter aim to capture him.

boardgame.name: Snilom
boardgame.description:
Autumn has arrived, the hedgehog family is preparing for a winter dream. Hedgehog diligently collects the autumn leaves to line the soft nook under the bushes. Help him collect as many leaves as possible!

Players roll the die to collect 1,2, or 3 leaves from the tree. But don't roll the wind or all your leaves will be blown away.

Which player will be the most skillful? Who manages to get more leaves and put them on your hedgehog? Fun family board game - not just for preschoolers.

boardgame.name: Selfie Crasher
boardgame.description:
The Selfie Crasher, or “Self-Crasher,” are alien beings from another star system who like to spoil the self-portrait of the Earthlings. All this by radiating ourselves into the image exactly when you press the shutter button. Sometimes we even clone ourselves to be on a picture multiple times. Count how many times we are seen on different selfies ahead of each other!

Your goal in the game is to get the most self-destruct cards with accurate counting and quick reaction.

boardgame.name: BrainBox: Vilgutaz
BrainBox: World Traveller
boardgame.description:
Which part of the world do you want to be in? BrainBox World Traveler is a board game that visits all continents while introducing you to countless celebrations, events and natural formations.
From the uninhabited areas of Australia, through the Amazon rainforest, through the Egyptian pyramids, to the pink sands of Bermuda, you can explore the World with this amazing game.

The object of the game is to make as much information as possible in 10 seconds about the location on the drawn card.
Did you observe and memorize everything well? Then roll the dice and answer the question by the number thrown out correctly. But don’t waste your time because the eyes on the hourglass will fly off quickly! You can check the answers on the card.
If you’re a good observer and already know the places of interest in the world well, most cards will land with you!

World travelers, can we go? No passport required!

boardgame.name: Kutyavilg krtyajtk
boardgame.description:
A dog tactical card game in which a lot depends on luck and sometimes you can spot players in a really heartless way.
As long as you moor your dog with a leash, you can cheat your teammate’s most valuable dog. Have the strongest deck of cards and you have a win. Exciting, varied board game full of cute dogs, labrador, fox, boxer and poodle.

You just don't want to go out with the dog because it's raining or the wind is raging? You know that can't be an obstacle for a real owner? But even if there’s no urge to take your kennel for a walk at this moment, you can still play a good one with your friends or family with the Dog World card. Grab your imaginary leash, then get started! The winner will be the one who collects the most reward points.

boardgame.name: Solar City: Heart of the City
Solar City: Serce Miasta
boardgame.description:
Powerful Corporations have started their fight for influence over the city. Solar Revolution, noble idea that once gathered mightiest minds fighting for common goal – the restoration of the environment, turned to a cruel fight for profits. Merciles lobbying from the developers interested only in most valuable plots of land for their majestic skyscrapers brings with it its first victims.

Heart of the City is a first expansion for Solar City. Inside, you’ll find 6 new building types. Every one of them introduces interaction between players. Invest in others’ real estate, gain influence over your opponent’s city or activate your districts gathering tax from other players. You’ll find this and much more in the heart of the city, where fight for influence took entirely new appearance! Buildings from the expansion can be freely mixed with buildings from the core game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Solar City: Suburbia
Solar City: Suburbs
boardgame.description:
The city grows, encroaching upon regions that not long ago were Green and unblemished by bulldozers’ tracks. Newly constructed skyscrapers tower upon long abandoned single story houses, inhabitants of which long since gone to friendlier places or died due to one of the numerous illnesses brought by civilization.

Suburbs is a second expansion for Solar City. Here you’ll find 6 completely new building types, introducing solutions revolutionizing how buildings work and gaining profits from developer investments. Every investment here is inherently linked with financial risk and the expansion itself introduces some degree of randomness concerning building activation. Daring construction plans allow you to copy effects of other buildings and even profit from activation of other districts! See what risky investments in Solar City can earn you! Buildings from the expansion can be freely mixed with buildings from the core game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Rampage in River City
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need some missions and adventures for your heroes in the world of the Super Power System? Here you go with our second Action Pack!

In this adventure pack, you get 5 exciting encounters and missions in the supernatural city of River City. Get voodoo magic, animal attacks, mysterious creatures, and gang wars in the city streets!

Get all the following in this 54 page volume:

2 ready-made player characters
2 game-ready NPCs from the Setting Guide
5 encounters with maps, instructions, XP suggestions, and custom NPCs
Detailed maps of the encounters

boardgame.name: Exiles of Newmarket
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The villagers of Newmarket have prospered from the new trade route passing through town. But a disgruntled former neighbor is about to get his revenge by turning the possessions they discarded when they got rich into animated objects and setting them against their former owners. Can your party save Newmarket from their old furniture and knick-knacks come back to bedevil them?

Exiles of Newmarket includes a new creature — swarm of animated objects — and several new non-magical items. It is published under the Open Game License. It doesn't specify a setting, so that you can integrate it into your own campaign world.

boardgame.name: The Prestigious Magician
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

ARE YOU WATCHING CLOSELY?

This 42-page book offers player options for Pathfinder Second Edition with a focus on stage-based magic performance, and provides a spellcasting class that doesn’t require you to keep track of spell slots! You gain ALL the cantrips in your tradition, develop your own suite of magic tricks, and perform with the best as you harry your foes.

This book includes a new class with 8 subclasses and its associated multiclass archetype, new class options, new cantrips, equipment to help you cast your spells in style, a magic-infused versatile heritage, backgrounds to give your character a prestigious backstory, and general feats to tie into a life of magical performance!

boardgame.name: Election Night
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Election Night 2068

It's time for the U.S.A. to pick a new president. The last several elections have been a series of shams, with the multinats of the Fortune Fifteen selecting puppet candidates to sit in the oval office.

Now, for the first time since the Fall of the Wall, there is a prole candidate who has gained a major party nomination! Mia Morales might be the best hope America has for a brighter future, if she can win. Of course, the multinats are not gonna make that easy...

Fight the Power

Citizens Divided is a dystopian cyberpunk view of the world fifty years from now. The climate has changed, corporate greed has led to economic collapse, class war, and widespread unrest. Explore the grungy streets of the crumbling prole villages as a Gutter Punk, fight for the rights and welfare of the weak as an ExoPilot, or bend the internet to your will as a Hacker!

New Options
New Stories

Election Night contains:

Two stories suitable for one-shots or to drop into your existing Citizens Divided campaign
New Antagonists
A dark look fifteen minutes into the future

boardgame.name: Mighty Atom
boardgame.description:
Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mighty_Atom_%281988_video_game%29 Mighty Atom (1988 video game)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Mighty Atom (, Tetsuwan Atomu) is a side-scrolling platform game published by Konami based on the manga and anime franchise Mighty Atom (Astro Boy in English) by Osamu Tezuka. The game was released exclusively in Japan for the Family Computer on February 26, 1988.

boardgame.name: Aldwater 2.0 (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

For centuries, the people of Aldwater have guarded and revered the wooden labyrinth holding the their ancestors' remains. Only the Spiritspeaker ever ventures inside, using an ancient relic to hold council with the dead. The wisdom of the council is vast, but not without fault, and for several years the advice of the ancestral spirits has done nothing to halt Aldwater's increasing plight. Each season, the shermen and trappers bring back a little less, and the children grow up a little hungrier.

In desperation, the Spiritspeaker recently allowed outsiders to petition the ancestors with questions, in return for donations. The inux of strangers in search of answers to lost questions and ancient riddles has brought much needed income to Aldwater, but resentment and anger brews among those who feel their most sacred traditions have been violated.

boardgame.name: Aldwater 2.0 (OSR)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

For centuries, the people of Aldwater have guarded and revered the wooden labyrinth holding the their ancestors' remains. Only the Spiritspeaker ever ventures inside, using an ancient relic to hold council with the dead. The wisdom of the council is vast, but not without fault, and for several years the advice of the ancestral spirits has done nothing to halt Aldwater's increasing plight. Each season, the shermen and trappers bring back a little less, and the children grow up a little hungrier.

In desperation, the Spiritspeaker recently allowed outsiders to petition the ancestors with questions, in return for donations. The inux of strangers in search of answers to lost questions and ancient riddles has brought much needed income to Aldwater, but resentment and anger brews among those who feel their most sacred traditions have been violated.

boardgame.description:

boardgame.description:

boardgame.name: TPP Villain Compendium I: Masterminds & Villains For Hire
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

These compendiums house all villains created from SIDs and Villainy Codex line from Tiger Paw Press. Volume I will contain Masterminds & Villains For Hire from these lines. This will give GMs several new villains to add to their campaigns to keep heroes on their toes. These compendiums will include new villains as well. Grab your copy and give your players a heart attack today.

boardgame.name: Cosmo Police Galivan
boardgame.description:
Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Galivan Galivan]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Cosmo Police Galivan ( Kosumoporisu Gyariban), is a single player, shoot-em-up arcade game developed and released worldwide by Nichibutsu. The game is inspired by the Japanese tokusatsu shows Space Sheriff Gavan and Space Sheriff Sharivan.

boardgame.name: Acid Death Fantasy
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

What happened is forgotten

Take your Troika! games to a new world of anarchic Sultans, beautiful plastic men, azure apes, steel gods and acid death.

The second official Troika! chapbook. 45 pages, 36 new backgrounds and 36 new enemies come together to create a new and acid-stained world for you to explore.

boardgame.name: Targeted Dream Incubator
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Horizon scanning real tech for your game

What is Five Minutes into the Future? (5MF)

5MF are a series of short guides scanning the horizon for cutting edge technologies being developed in the real-world right now. Each issue will present one piece of nu-tech and some ways that you can use it in your roleplaying games.

Volume 1.2 features the Dream Incubator, a device that can influence people's dreams.

Inside you'll find details of:

how the technology works in real life,
a mind-twisting heist setting,
a darkened-mirror cyberpunk setting where every smart device uses the technology to advertise in your dreams,
a techno-horror setting where the manipulated dreams are used to deliver a ritual that frees a dream-demon, and
a post-apocalypse setting where linked dreams cause the collapse of the human shared psyche and the birth of a maelstrom.


5MF is largely system neutral, and presents ideas suitable for a variety of modern and near future genres, including:

modern,
heist,
espionage,
technoir,
near future,
superhero,
cyberpunk,
modern horror,
hard sci-fi, and
(post)-apocalyptic.


Finally, I finish each guide with just a little bit of crunch so you can use the technology (with rules and related character options) in a handful of popular, different systems including;

Fate,
Powered by the Apocalypse, and
D20 modern systems.

boardgame.name: Sanrio Cup: Pon Pon Volley
boardgame.description:
Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sanrio_Cup%3A_Pon_Pon_Volley Sanrio Cup: Pon Pon Volley]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Sanrio Cup: Pon Pon Volley () is a volleyball video game featuring many of the popular Sanrio characters including Hello Kitty, Keroppi and Minna no Tabo. Matches can be played in with either two, three or four players. Players can choose between three different tracks of background music, or to simply play without the music.[3]

The game is basically a volleyball/tennis game but without the nets, closely resembling four-square. There is an option to increase the difficulty level that modifies the level of intelligence with which computer-controlled play. There are opportunities to commit do-overs. After the end of the game, the player is awarded with a large ostrich trophy.

boardgame.name: Feldsher
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An Feldsher class for the Low Fantasy Gaming system.

"You are a Feldsher, an expert practitioner of healing sciences. Your unique skills and knowledge of medicine allow you to support allies and impair foes while in the midst of combat. Outside of battle, you provide potent benefits by allowing others to better recover from their wounds. For these reasons, you are excitedly welcomed to any group of adventurers who anticipate needing frequent use of your unique skills."

boardgame.name: The Grid
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The grid - the endless runway of neon-lit data that hackers, codeslingers and A.I.s call home. It has invaded every part of modern life and made itself an unavoidable spectre that watches, listens and controls the lives of the careless and unwary. In this supplement for NEON CITY OVERDRIVE the grid is explored and explained, providing you the tools to take your games off the street and into the digitized wonderland of the sprawling data network.

This book includes:

Jacking in: How the grid is used, including descriptions of the key infrastructure and technologies such as the holographic overlay, data hubs, private networks and interface gear.
Exploring the grid: Getting around the grid, descriptions of key locations and dozens of story hooks. Run the digital streets, hang out in Underwire, marvel at the mysterious Beam or ride the information super-highway that is the ribbon.
New hazards and threats: Dangerous locations, enemies and programs are presented to threaten codeslingers and spice up grid runs. Watch out for data storms and oubliettes, defy grid cops and gate guardians and avoid the dreaded black ICE.
Playing the grid: Advice on using the grid in your games, new grid-specific conditions and traumas, and further guidance on the process of piggy-backing grid observers.
Trademarks and gear: Twenty-five new trademarks, advice on playing an artificial intelligence and examples to help you represent grid technology and programs as special gear.


The Grid continues to expand the world of NEON CITY OVERDRIVE with new character options, enemies and story hooks. Use the information as presented, or use the advice provided to adjust the setting details to fit your own vision of how cyberpunks interface with the virtual world.

boardgame.name: JaJaMaru no Daibouken
boardgame.description:
Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JaJaMaru_no_Daibouken JaJaMaru no Daibouken]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

JaJaMaru no Daibouken (, "JaJaMaru's Great Adventure") is a Family Computer video game that was released exclusively for a Japanese market in 1986.

The concept of the game is that the player controls a red ninja as he progress through a series of Japanesque levels defeating evil spirits that have spread across the land. The player can even ride his faithful frog if he can recover it from hiding.

boardgame.name: The Landshark of Kulderhaven
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

If you find yourself out on the cold streets of Kulderhaven after dark, you’d best say your prayers and prepare for death. All night, every night, a monster from the ocean depths crawls its way between the homes in this once-quaint fishing village. It’s only motive: murder. If you can smell its stinking brine upon the breeze before you reach the safety of your home, there is no way to save your skin but one. You can run, but you can’t hide.

Lock your doors and bar the windows. This creature only walks beneath the stars, driven by some astral force that knows nought but evil. Though it is loathe to come beneath a ceiling of any kind, it will not balk at reaching in, through any gap or hole there is, to pull you out and make fish food of your unlucky carcass.

boardgame.name: Chirpee
boardgame.description:
Chirpee is a matching card game for kids of all ages. It has super simple rules, perky illustrations, and a short game play time. 54 full color cards for 2 to 8 players ages 8 and up. It takes between 10 to twenty minutes to play.
On a players turn they will try to match something about the active card and a card in their hand. There are a variety of things that can be matched, the bird itself can be matched as well as the presence of a sword, shield, flag, head gear, and bow. Once a match can be made the player places their match on top of the active card creating a new active card. The winner is the player that empties their hand first.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Kaiju Keepers
boardgame.description:
The planet is facing a crisis of unprecedented scale. To aid humanity, a Kaiju (Strange Beast) has appeared, 80 meters tall and absolutely monstrous. You are the Kaiju Keepers, 100-year-old druids with mystical abilities. Your goal is to direct the Kaiju and its immense size and power to save the planet.
Collateral damage is expected. Don't worry about that. Just save the world.

boardgame.name: Vende Globe: Le Jeu de Socit
boardgame.description:
Vendée Globe - Set off on your monohull and circumnavigate the world in the pure Vendée Globe tradition, solo, non-stop and without assistance, but staying at home. Sail the Atlantic, the Indian and the Pacific, with friends or family, thanks to the official Vendée Globe board game.

Aficionados or beginners, to overcome this ordeal, you will need to avoid OFNIS / UFO (unidentified floating objects), ration your food and answer questions of different levels of difficulty.

Take weather options and make the right choice of sails to beat your competition.

Your sailboat race around the world by progressing on spaces. On each space, an action is requested. It may be to answer a Quiz question or undergo an event.

2 to 6 skippers can line up at the start and freshwater sailors are welcome from 7 years old.

Rest assured, you don't need to spend 78 days at sea to win, since a board tour takes between 30 and 45 minutes.


1 game box.
1 game board.
132 playing cards.
1 board with parts to detach and assemble:
3 movable parts,
2 card shoes (Quiz and Event),
Sponsor cards + Sails + food tokens.

1 ruleset
1 bag (containg a needle, 6 game pawn bases, 3 shielded ties)

boardgame.name: Craftsmen Desire Weird
boardgame.description:
Using a simple class-based 2d6 system, this game allows adventuring craftsmen (and -women) to seek the weird they desire. Members of various crafts guilds, the PCs are sent on a mission to seek weird artifacts that might increase the knowledge of their respective guilds. Although the guilds do not know it, the PCs band together with adventurers of other guilds the better to succeed at - and survive! - their mission. Hopefully they will amicably split up any loot found before returning to their home guilds.

The title comes from a random roll on tables presented to contest participants for inspiration. The author rolled "Craftsmen Desire Weird", which became the inspiration for this game.


Of possible interest to some of you: weird was originally a noun (not an adjective) meaning destiny or fate. Somewhat later it came to mean what I had in mind when writing this game: the supernatural ability to control destiny. Only centuries later did it become an adjective with its current meaning.

boardgame.name: Matchmaker
boardgame.description:
There’s a plethora of dating sites in the internet. Some are straight-to-the-point, some are subtler. Everybody knows someone who’s on those sites. So, let’s make a new one!

This game requires at least two players. There is no game master. It is preferable to have an even number of participants, but that’s not mandatory. Matchmaker tries to catch the spirit of internet dating. It doesn’t matter how compatible you seem to be, it still is up to luck.

boardgame.name: 18CH: Chilean Railways
boardgame.description:
18CH is a railroad-building and investment game set in the country of Chile, in South America. 18CH is a game in a series of loosely-related games collectively known as 18xx games, originated by Francis Tresham with 1829.

18CH features a government railroad — The Empresa de los Ferrocarriles del Estado Railway (EFE) — a long narrow map, and five small narrow-gauge railways called "nitrate corporations", which were built to connect the mines with these resources to major Chilean ports.

boardgame.name: Until the End of the Line
boardgame.description:
Until the End of the Line is a solo narrative role-playing game about running away. It is a game about taking a train as far as it can go to try to escape your problems.

This is a game where you create a character and write journal entries from their point of view about how they are feeling on their journey. It is about reflecting on the past, and hoping for a better future.
boardgame.rpg: Until the End of the Line

boardgame.name: Pays de Cornouaille: le Jeu !
boardgame.description:
Pays de Cornouaille le Jeu !

is an original, local and user-friendly board game based on the principle of questions and answers.
Nearly 1000 written and visual questions including 100 "junior" questions which deal with subjects as varied as History or geography, heritage, local traditions, current events or famous people who have marked the Pays de Cornouaille.

Questions relating to all the municipalities in the territory:

Haut Pays Bigouden: Pouldreuzic, Gourlizon, Guiler-sur-Goyen, Landudec, Peumerit, Plogastel-Saint-Germain, Plonéour-Lanvern, Plovan, Plozévet, Tréogat
Pays Bigouden Sud: Combrit, Le Guilvinec, Île-Tudy, Loctudy, Penmarc'h, Plobannalec-Lesconil, Plomeur, Pont-l'Abbé, Saint-Jean-Trolimon, Treffiagat, Tréguennec, Tréméoc
Quimper Community: Ergué-Gabéric, Guengat, Plogonnec, Plomelin, Plonéis, Pluguffan, Quimper
Fouesnantais country: Bénodet, Clohars-Fouesnant, La Forêt-Fouesnant, Fouesnant, Gouesnac'h, Pleuven, Saint-Evarzec
Pays de Châteaulin Porzay: Cast, Châteaulin, Dinéault, Ploéven, Plomodiern, Plonévez-Porzay, Port-Launay, Quéménéven, Saint-Coulitz, Saint-Nic, Trégarvan
Glazik country: Briec, Edern, Landrévarzec, Landudal, Langolen,
Cap Sizun: Audierne, Beuzec-Cap-Sizun, Cléden-Cap-Sizun, Confort-Meilars, Esquibien, Goulien, Mahalon, Plogoff, Plouhinec, Pont-Croix, Primelin.
Pays de Douarnenez: Douarnenez, Poullan sur mer, Pouldergat, Le Juch, Kerlaz
Pays de Quimperlé: Arzano Bannalec, Baye, Clohars-Carnoët, Guilligomarc'h, Locunolé, Mellac, Moëlan-sur-Mer, Querrien, Quimperlé, Rédené, Riec-sur-Belon, Saint-Thurien, Scaër, Tréméven, Le Trévoux
Pays de Concarneau Cornouaille: Concarneau, Elliant, Melgven, Nevez, Pont-Aven, Rosporden, Saint-Yvi, Tourc'h, Trégunc
+ the municipalities of Locronan and Ile de Sein

boardgame.name: Khara Khang's Random Rainbow Maze: Deadly Combat (dT&T Version)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Khara Khang just loves to set up lethal tests for those who would serve the Death Goddess. Can you find your way through the maze and defeat the denizens who live there, and will you be ready for the final threat?

boardgame.name: Vvvarrr's Qiip: Deadly Combat (Monsters! Monsters! Version)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Deadly Combat series illustrate how the same adventure can be used with different gaming rules. Although deluxe Tunnels & Trolls has many things in common with Monsters! Monsters!2d edition, there are some notable differences also. In this adventure, you, the player take the role of a monster seeking immortality from a dragon. Although I illustrated the book with a skeleton man, you could be a troll, ogre, goblin, uruk or some other humanoid illkind. How will you manage to deal with a dragon when you go beyond Vvvarrr's Qiip?

boardgame.name: Vvvarrr's Qiip: Deadly Combat (Tunnels & Trolls Version)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Vvvarrr's Qiip is a village of nonhuman apemen that lies on the slopes of Vvvarrr's mountain far to the northeast in the Kharghish range, and it is the story of an adventurer--you--who dares to seek out the dragon, Vvvarrr, in a quest for immortality. Explore one of the remotest corners of the world. Meet an immortal dragon who has been on the planet longer than known history. Learn some of the lore about the origin of Lerotra'hh, the Death Goddess of Khazan. VQ is a solo adventure for the bravest of players, and it comes with instructions to enable you to run it as a quest for a whole party of T & T players--a GM adventure. This solo is one of the largest and most ambitious of Ken St. Andre's Tales of Trollworld.

boardgame.name: Numenera Map Pack 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This officially-licensed Numenera map pack depicts the City of Qi, greatest urban center of the Steadfast, at poster size! On the back, a mysterious futuristic vehicle or installation at miniature scale is waiting to be explored! Combine it with the Technological Complex from Numenera Map Pack 1 to show a sprawling sci-fi adventure environment rich with peril and enigma.

Poster measures 22 by 34 inches, and is printed on glossy stock. Pre-folded to 8.5 by 5.5 inches and packaged within a clear resealable envelope for safe shipping.

Includes a free 5 by 8 inch terrain card featuring an energized pillar chamber, PLUS a bonus, double-sided, 11 by 17 inch B&W mini-poster of the city map, suitable as a player handout!

boardgame.name: Crypt of the Science-Wizard (D/MCC)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome, brave adventurers, back to the time of exploration, where brains are more important than brawn, and courage wins the day. Challenge yourselves against the Crypt of the Science-Wizard, and discover if you have what it takes to emerge as a hero, or escape at all.

Far out in the Blood Plains of Esh lies an oasis, humble and unassuming. What secrets does it hide in its depths? The tomb of a forsaken lich? A hidden laboratory, promising secrets of science and technology forgotten by the ages? The entrance to a vast Black Tower, swallowed by the will and fury of the ancient gods? Only the hardiest may survive to tell the tales!

Crypt of the Science-Wizard is a site-based adventure designed for use with the Dungeon Crawl Classic and Mutant Crawl Classic rulesets. For characters of any level, and players of all ages.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
Mutant Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Crypt of the Science-Wizard (S&W)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome, brave adventurers, back to the time of exploration, where brains are more important than brawn, and courage wins the day. Challenge yourselves against the Crypt of the Science-Wizard, and discover if you have what it takes to emerge as a hero, or escape at all.

Far out in the Blood Plains of Esh lies an oasis, humble and unassuming. What secrets does it hide in its depths? The tomb of a forsaken lich? A hidden laboratory, promising secrets of science and technology forgotten by the ages? The entrance to a vast Black Tower, swallowed by the will and fury of the ancient gods? Only the hardiest may survive to tell the tales!

Crypt of the Science-Wizard is a site-based adventure designed for use with the Swords & Wizardry ruleset. For characters of any level, and players of all ages.
